tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
I live in Dubai and was consulting a doctor there for pregnancy. My husband and I decided to have the delivery in Bangalore, India. I was worried about finding the best doctor near my location in blr because I had my 6-month pregnancy checkup done in Dubai. when I needed to arrange my delivery while searching on Practo for a doctor, I found Dr. Manjula ma'am .  I have been getting my check-ups done by Manjula ma'am since the 7th month of my pregnancy. She is not only a very good doctor but also a very kind person. Ma'am induced me at 8:30 pm on 7th may and the whole night I was in pain but she is available all the time also she called to duty Dr. And asking for updates for my progress of giving birth.
I remember when I was in the labor room in pain, I kept asking for a C-section, but ma'am motivated me and said, "What's the use of enduring labor pain for so long if we end up with a C-section anyway?" She motivated me again to try for a normal delivery. I had lost hope of having a normal delivery due to weight gain, low water level. but ma'am motivated me, and finally, I had a normal delivery and on 8th May, I gave birth and was blessed with baby girl.
Thank you, ma'am.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
context: Childbirth,Pregnancy Check Up,Pre and Post Delivery Care,Caesarean Section (C Section),
review: This is our second baby with Dr Manjula and she never ceases to amaze us with the love, dedication and care she has showed us during this journey as well. We had our Daughter in 2020 and I can see a huge growth in the number of patients consulting her now (and will only keep growing). Her popularity has grown purely due to the care and dedication she has shown to each one of her patients. Cloudnine is lucky to have such an amazing Doctor on board with them and she is a true asset to this organization. We were blessed with our Son in April of 2024 and Dr Manjula‚Äôs made it so easy and memorable for us again.  A big thank you to Dr Manjula and her amazing team. Dr Manjula is our Guardian Angel. Thank you again for all that you do.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
I visited for Pregnancy Check Up, Pre and Post Delivery Care, High-Risk Pregnancy Care, Pregnancy Tests

I wish to share my experience with Manjula mam. I had a cardiomyopathy issue from my childhood. I got married nd immediately got pregnant. But many doctors advised strictly against pregnancy since it was very risky for my life nd not to continue further. So two times we terminated the baby within 50days of pregnancy. I was very depressed and longing badly for a child in our life. By God's grace we were shifted to Bangalore because of my husband's job nd came to know about Dr.Manjula mam. I got pregnant third time nd visited mam. At the first visit itself she was very positive nd gave us so much confidence nd she was ready to take the risk along with us. She really took all the great efforts to make everything in a very positive nd smooth way nd she referred a cardiologist who is a friend of her. Everything was very smooth throughout out my pregnancy till delivery and finally delivered a baby boy at 37 weeks via c section since it was risky to have a normal delivery. Then after a year we shifted back to our native. I got pregnant again when my son was 1.3yrs old. I was very scared and not in a mentality to visit any doctors there.

 So we immediately called Dr.Manjula mam. We consulted with her virtually till my 5th month but this time it was not a smooth journey. I developed many symptoms like breathlessness, chest pain, high palpitations, etc. So we visited her directly after a long 8hrs journey. But as soon as we met her we got that positivity again in our hearts. Our cardiologist was very upset nd not much happy to continue this pregnancy since my health was not good. But mam gave us lots of hope nd try to get everything positive. She asked us to come at 32 weeks and stay there in Bangalore itself till delivery. She doesn't wish to continue my pregnancy beyond 34 weeks due to my negative ECG nd holter reports. So she asked us to admit immediately at 34 weeks that too not in cloudnine but at the nearby hospital because of the ICU and cardio facilities available there. She literally took more efforts for everything to be very safe nd she was very conscious in arranging all the doctors and procedures in a pre-planned manner. I finally delivered a baby girl at August 17th 2022 but my baby was kept in NICU for 4 days. But with God's grace and Mam's support we were ready to get back to our home. Dr.Manjula mam is really a God sent Angel to us nd we never met such a doctor in our life. She is a true gem of a human being. We love her so much nd am missing her badly. We were longing for one baby but now we are blessed with two both boy and girl. Manjula mam is such a friendly positive energetic smiling doctor. We recommend her 200%. Sorry for the long story. With so much love from Fahima Faizal.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
context: Pregnancy Check Up,Pregnancy Tests,Labor and Delivery,
review:
Dr. Manjula Deepak Mam is definitely a God-sent angel. She carries positive vibes and I would definitely recommend her for any Gynecology consultations. After having two recurrent miscarriages, we were so shattered and lost hope. But it‚Äôs because of her best treatment and true support that we are happy parents to a lovely baby girl.

Here is our story:

It was at the end of 2019, after going through 2 recurrent miscarriages, that we got to know about Dr. Manjula Deepak Mam from a close friend. We immediately booked a consultation and visited her at Cloud Nine HRBR Layout. On our first visit, she looked (that was the only time) at all our history and lab reports, and patiently listened to us. On our next visit, we were surprised to see that she remembered every single piece of information about my history and she ensured that she provided only the best care and treatment.

Then comes COVID in early 2020. We moved to our hometown, gave ourselves a break, and didn't see a doctor for close to a year. We again planned to resume and mentally prepare for pregnancy around mid-2021. We booked an online video consultation with Dr. Manjula Deepak without hesitation, and you wouldn't believe it, even though we connected with her after a year, she remembered every detail and didn't make me feel any less disconnected, and we resumed from where we left off almost a year ago. The doctor helped me with the next set of plans and diets. She deserves a huge amount of respect for her dedication and for being so passionate about her profession and providing personal attention to every single patient.

I was pregnant again and immediately booked the next video consultation with the doctor. Although all this happened virtually, she ensured I was given the best care and attention and prescribed the medicines to get started with.

We moved back to Bangalore in November 2021 for our future consultations and visited the doctor at the hospital. From then on, it was like a big relief and we were so confident that we had got Manjula Deepak Mam with us. Due to previous complications, we used to be nervous whenever there was a scan, and for everything small, I used to message Mam, as I was afraid that something might go wrong. She replied to each and every question on message without any irritation, even though she was always super busy. It was a high-risk pregnancy, but she handled it very smoothly. Mam is always calm and positive, and some days, though she is awake the whole night for emergency delivery, when we visit her in the morning for consultations, she will be with the same beautiful smile and positivity. She told us that this time we would hold our baby in our hands and it came true.

She was so particular and conscious enough that there were no chances of uncertainties by closely monitoring the pregnancy at more frequent intervals, giving us much needed moral support and strength, making us stay positive throughout.

Finally, the day arrived. The doctor informed us well in advance about the delivery process, and we were asked to get admitted. I was induced by night and Mam informed the duty doctors to keep monitoring the baby's heartbeat and to inform her about my status, and she assured me if there was any urgency she would be there in 5 mins in hospital. She was frequently checking on my status that night and the next morning, we were blessed with a little angel . In the labor room, she was so supportive. Her words made me feel better when I was in so much pain.

Pregnancy is definitely a smooth journey with a wonderful human being like Dr. Manjula Deepak Mam. I miss visiting Mam in the hospital. She is a very down-to-earth person, and she talks to you like your sister and friend. We can‚Äôt thank Mam enough for all her efforts. This is the shortest I could write about Mam.
reply_text: Thank you very much lavanya for your kind words it means a lot to me

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Doctor friendliness,Wait time,Value for money,
context: High-Risk Pregnancy Care,Pregnancy Check Up,Abortion / Medical Termination of Pregnancy (MTP),Pregnant Women Counseling,Normal Vaginal Delivery (NVD),
review:
First of all, I would say a BIG THANK YOU to Manjula mam. She is among the best doctor in Obstetrics and Gynaecology and always tries for a normal delivery unless there is anything serious and does the best possible treatment. I recommend everyone to consult her without a second thought in mind.¬†Once you visit her, you will get to know that you are in a safe¬†and the¬†best hand and will never regret it.¬†

We are blessed with a baby through a normal delivery even after my wife was running on insulin since she got gestational diabetes at the end of 3rd month of pregnancy. I have a long story that I am going to describe¬†below which may be useful for others.

We had consulted Dr. Manjula Deepak first time after the completion of about 3 months of my wife's first pregnancy. Before this, we had consulted two more doctors in Bengaluru but were not satisfied because they¬†were not allowing husbands to talk to the doctor (I understand it was covid time, but still husbands should also meet the doctors), not describing everything in detail, and not answering all the question. We had many questions since it was the first pregnancy. I did google and found Dr. Manjula Deepak with many good reviews and decided to consult her.
Coming to our story, Our first baby was having multiple abnormalities which were identified by Dr. Manjula mam and her team (Dr. Kavyashree KS) at the time of the anomaly scan. It was very shocking for us¬†and hard to believe. But the doctor wanted to have a second opinion before taking any further steps because it was critical and referred us to Bangalore Fetal Medicine Centre (BFMC). We went to BFMC and found there were some patients having similar or another type¬†of criticality in their pregnancy¬†and were referred to BFMC for a second opinion from many well-known hospitals. Doctors in BFMC did an anomaly scan for my wife and they too found the same issue and suggested aborting the baby because it was not easy for the baby to survive in this world or there were high chances to have more complications in the future. BFMC doctors¬†explained the whole thing in more detail and answered all of our questions. We headed back to mam with the BFMC reports and she also suggested abortion and gave us time for a few days to make the final decision. In the meantime, I did some research on google, checked with some other sources, consulted families and friends, etc because it was not easy for us to abort our first baby and finally we decided to go with the doctor's suggestion. My wife got admitted and the doctor did an abortion. I saw the baby and it was the same as presented in the anomaly scan report. It was the most painful day of our life.¬†

We consulted Manjula mam after some days and were worried that will it be similar if we plan for the next child? She told us it happens sometimes and is very rare. She recommended planning for the next baby after three months and don't think much about these things. She gave us enough confidence to plan for the next baby and promised that she will be giving us a healthy baby this time and will take care of everything¬†from the beginning itself.

Good news came after eight or nine months and we consulted with Dr. Manjula mam and did whatever she suggested and continued consulting her. Everything went normal but after the completion of the 3rd month, my wife got Gestational Diabetes and the doctor told us that we should control¬†this until delivery by diet, physical activities, or insulin if required. Else it may impact the growth of the baby. Again we got shocked and trusted the doctor and followed her advice since we got¬†enough faith in her by this time. She referred us to a Dietician and an¬†Endocrinologist to control sugar levels. My wife did the same and was in observation¬†by her, Dietician, and Endocrinologist.¬†

Now the time came for the anomaly¬†scan and we visited the same doctor Kavyashree KS who was aware of our past. We were so much scared and were praying to god at the time of the scan. I thanked a lot¬†to god and the doctors when we got the report and felt very happy,¬†everything¬†was normal. We continued following up with the doctor and Endocrinologist.
At around the 7th month of pregnancy, we moved to another doctor (don't want to name her¬†here,¬†but I will refer to her¬†as ABC) due to some financial issues. Whenever¬†we consulted ABC, she use to give us a lot of tension, used to scare us and never thought about the normal delivery, and always¬†suggested¬†a C section, else there may be a risk for the baby. We continued consulting with ABC up to about the 9th month and were worried about the ABC's words she use to speak at the time of consultation, we were getting sleepless nights.¬†

Finally, we decided to consult Dr. Manjula Deepak again and went to her and explained¬†everything. She was too polite and understood our situation and convinced us that there is¬†nothing to worry about and everything is under control. She told me 95% of the chances are there that she will do a normal delivery and rest upon God (We too agreed here). I told her, mam do whatever you feel the best, I left everything to her and she was the next person after God for us.
Since my wife was on insulin due to Gestational Diabetes, Dr. Manjula mam had to plan delivery before the due date by inducing pain. We planned for this and did accordingly. Delivery was not very easy and that took so much effort from¬†mam's side. She was very calm and active during the whole process. There was a time when even I thought of saying the doctor to go for a C section, but I already had left everything on mam and was knowing that she will be performing her best and finally, we are blessed with a healthy baby. Tears came to my eyes and I thanked a lot¬†Dr. Manjula mam and God for blessing us with the baby.¬†

I am 100% sure that if it was any other doctor, definitely¬†it was done through a C section.

Now I am very happy with my kid and my wife!!! Again credit goes to Dr. Manjula mam!!!
reply_text: Thank you very much Anuj for your kind words it means a lot to me

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
*** ******* ****** ** *** ** *** **** ************* ** ********** I am so happy that I decided to visit her for my pregnancy. She is very humble, caring, down to earth and would make you feel absolutely comfortable right from the very first visit. I must say, she's super beautiful too. 
My pregnancy journey was quite rough. This was also my first pregnancy. I had severe nausea/vomiting & heartburn since the start of my pregnancy due to which I faced severe gastric problems. Dr. Manjula would always reply to my queries on WatsApp almost immediately.  At times, late in the evening/ night i would require medical attention as I would go through terrible stomach pains. Dr.Manjula would answer my calls every time and patiently guide me. She would also call the duty doctor @cloudnine and instruct as to what needs to be done upon my arrival. 
In my 7th month of pregnancy, i had to face my nightmare. I became Covid19 positive. Words cannot express my fear as to what was going to happen in the coming days. I was so scared of losing my baby, but Dr.Manjula gave me a lot of strength and positivity. Even during those critical times, Dr.Manjula has been a great support to me and my family. She guided me to get admitted to another hospital and was also in constant touch with the doctors there monitoring my medicines. By God's grace I recoverd and my baby was also fine in my womb. 
I was 36 weeks pregnant when my water broke unexpectedly on Dec 2nd 2020 early morning around 3 am. I was very weak after all that i had been through previously. I was prepared for a C-section mentally. Me and my husband rushed to Cloudnine. I was examined and labour was induced at around 4:30 am. I had silently dropped a message on WhatsApp mentioning the situation and that I was there at the hospital. Dr.Manjula was there at the hospital at around 6:30 am. Upon seeing her, there was a sense of relief and i knew she would take care of me & the entire situation. Dr.Manjula and her team were so supportive & encouraging throughout my labour while i screaming and crying in excruciating pain.  I have a very low tolerance to pain. But, I went with the flow and delivered a beautiful girl baby at 1:41 pm Dec 2nd 2020. It was a normal delivery. My baby was born sunny side up. I didnt have faith in me that it was going to be an NVD. In fact no one did even in my family, but Dr.Manjula made it happen. I guess she believed in me. 

Am so glad that God chose Dr.Manjula to be my doctor. I can't thank her enough for giving me my miracle baby in my hands. 
God bless her and her beautiful family. ‚ù§Ô∏è
From the bottom of hearts, Thank You Doctor üòä.
- Mary & Robert
reply_text: Thank you very much Mary for your kind words it means a lot to me

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
My wife (Arpita) has been seeing Dr Manjula since April this year from the very beginning of her pregnancy. We got to know about her pregnancy right in the middle of the National Lockdown. My wife was very tense because of the COVID situation at that point in time and we were unsure how things will pan out. We did an online check of various gynecologists and obstetricians across Bangalore on Practo and other websites and came across Dr Manjula‚Äôs profile. We were amazed at her rating (100%) with over 700 reviews. What was also incredible was that almost 80% of those who gave ratings shared their stories. We did not find any other gynecologist across Bangalore who had a 100% rating along with such high number of reviews. Even most of the renowned doctors had 97-98% rating but 100% rating was unheard of. We were quite curious and we decided to visit her, even though the Cloudnine HRBR branch where she is based is relatively far from our place. 
After first few visits, we slowly figured out the reasons for her perfect ratings. Dr Manjula came across as a very friendly, polite and patient person. But the thing that stands out about her is her relaxed attitude. She will put her patients at ease and remove all stress and tension. She does not prescribe any unnecessary tests or medicines and tries her best to ensure that the pregnancy follows a natural path. Throughout the pregnancy, my wife had frequent bouts of nausea and vomiting, but the doctor assured her that it was normal and not to be worried at all. She encourages positivity all the time. My wife had lot of questions (especially since it was her first pregnancy), but the doctor answered all of them patiently. She even gave her watsapp number. My wife used to get her doubts and queries clarified from time to time on watsapp and invariably the doctor would always reply in spite of her busy schedule. 
Couple of more things I would like to mention about Dr Manjula. She remembers all her patients by name (which I find quite incredible given that she would be meeting several new patients every week). Also, she has a very good rapport with her staff. She treats them and talks to them as her equal (just like talking to a friend). This is a rare quality and shows that she is humble, kind and has a great soul. I could see the kind of respect all the staff members had for her. 
In the middle of her pregnancy, my wife was thinking of going to her home town in Kolkata for couple of months. Doctor gave her the go ahead and also provided a fit to fly certificate. After 2 months just before my wife was expected to fly back, we had a discussion of whether the delivery should happen in Kolkata or Bangalore. However, we decided that it was best for her to come back mainly because of the confidence we had in Dr Manjula. After coming back, my wife underwent a CBC test and her hemoglobin came quite low (8.4). Dr Manjula suggested her to take 2 doses of iron infusion. After taking those doses, her hemoglobin went up to 11.2 in a month‚Äôs time. 
During the last scan, my wife was detected with polyhydramnios (very high levels of amniotic fluid) which occurs in just 1% pregnancies. We were quite worried on hearing this but Dr Manjula spent significant amount of time with us, calmed us down and assured us that my wife and our baby were in safe hands and there was nothing to worry. She suggested that we will need to go for Caesarian (because of the polyhydramnios) and it needed to be done within a week. She even gave us the option of choosing the date and time. She clarified all our doubts, laid to rest all our concerns and explained us the entire process of admission and operation. She also assured us that even if there was any emergency at any time before the day of operation, we could just walk in and get admitted and she will come over immediately (Dr Manjula stays just 5 minutes away from the hospital). We went back home satisfied. We chose the date and time of operation and intimated her. 
On 30th Nov on the day of the operation, we reached the hospital early in the morning. All admission formalities were done smoothly and within couple of hours my wife was all set for the operation. In the operation theatre, as my wife was being administered anesthesia, she started sobbing uncontrollably as she got a bit scared. The doctor immediately comforted her and helped her to calm down. Soon she lost consciousness. In the middle of the operation, my wife just remembers hearing the words ‚Äúits a sweet baby girl‚Äù. The operation went smoothly and baby was born healthy. 
When my wife was discharged after 3 days, she had mostly recovered. My wife recovered much faster compared to most people we know of. We believe strongly that this has more to do with the quality of her operation and doctor‚Äôs encouragement to start getting active at the earliest. Dr Manjula called us back after a week, removed the dressing (which had almost healed) and explained to us clearly the way forward. Our next visit is scheduled after 6 months. 
Overall we had an overwhelming experience with Dr Manjula and we would like to thank her from the bottom of our heart for her guidance, advise, encouragement and everything she has done for my wife throughout this period. Most importantly, we would like to thank her for delivering to us the best gift of our life. We will be eternally grateful to her.
reply_text: Thank you very much Anik and Arpita for your kind words it means a lot to me

review: I wish to share my experience with Manjula mam. I had a cardiomyopathy issue from my childhood. I got married nd immediately got pregnant. But many doctors advised strictly against pregnancy since it was very risky for my life nd not to continue further. So two times we terminated the baby within 50days of pregnancy. I was very depressed and longing badly for a child in our life. By God's grace we were shifted to Bangalore because of my husband's job nd came to know about Dr.Manjula mam. I got pregnant third time nd visited mam. At the first visit itself she was very positive nd gave us so much confidence nd she was ready to take the risk along with us. She really took all the great efforts to make everything in a very positive nd smooth way nd she referred a cardiologist who is a friend of her. Everything was very smooth throughout out my pregnancy till delivery and finally delivered a baby boy at 37 weeks via c section since it was risky to have a normal delivery. Then after a year we shifted back to our native. I got pregnant again when my son was 1.3yrs old. I was very scared and not in a mentality to visit any doctors there. So we immediately called Dr.Manjula mam. We consulted with her virtually till my 5th month but this time it was not a smooth journey. I developed many symptoms like breathlessness, chest pain, high palpitations, etc. So we visited her directly after a long 8hrs journey. But as soon as we met her we got that positivity again in our hearts. Our cardiologist was very upset nd not much happy to continue this pregnancy since my health was not good. But mam gave us lots of hope nd try to get everything positive. She asked us to come at 32 weeks and stay there in Bangalore itself till delivery. She doesn't wish to continue my pregnancy beyond 34 weeks due to my negative ECG nd holter reports. So she asked us to admit immediately at 34 weeks that too not in cloudnine but at the nearby hospital because of the ICU and cardio facilities available there. She literally took more efforts for everything to be very safe nd she was very conscious in arranging all the doctors and procedures in a pre-planned manner. I finally delivered a baby girl at August 17th 2022 but my baby was kept in NICU for 4 days. But with God's grace and Mam's support we were ready to get back to our home. context: Pregnancy Check Up,Pregnancy Tests,Labor and Delivery,
review:
Dr. Manjula Deepak Mam is definitely a God-sent angel. She carries positive vibes and I would definitely recommend her for any Gynecology consultations. After having two recurrent miscarriages, we were so shattered and lost hope. But it‚Äôs because of her best treatment and true support that we are happy parents to a lovely baby girl.

Here is our story:

It was at the end of 2019, after going through 2 recurrent miscarriages, that we got to know about Dr. Manjula Deepak Mam from a close friend. We immediately booked a consultation and visited her at Cloud Nine HRBR Layout. On our first visit, she looked (that was the only time) at all our history and lab reports, and patiently listened to us. On our next visit, we were surprised to see that she remembered every single piece of information about my history and she ensured that she provided only the best care and treatment.

Then comes COVID in early 2020. We moved to our hometown, gave ourselves a break, and didn't see a doctor for close to a year. We again planned to resume and mentally prepare for pregnancy around mid-2021. We booked an online video consultation with Dr. Manjula Deepak without hesitation, and you wouldn't believe it, even though we connected with her after a year, she remembered every detail and didn't make me feel any less disconnected, and we resumed from where we left off almost a year ago. The doctor helped me with the next set of plans and diets. She deserves a huge amount of respect for her dedication and for being so passionate about her profession and providing personal attention to every single patient.

I was pregnant again and immediately booked the next video consultation with the doctor. Although all this happened virtually, she ensured I was given the best care and attention and prescribed the medicines to get started with.

We moved back to Bangalore in November 2021 for our future consultations and visited the doctor at the hospital. From then on, it was like a big relief and we were so confident that we had got Manjula Deepak Mam with us. Due to previous complications, we used to be nervous whenever there was a scan, and for everything small, I used to message Mam, as I was afraid that something might go wrong. She replied to each and every question on message without any irritation, even though she was always super busy. It was a high-risk pregnancy, but she handled it very smoothly. Mam is always calm and positive, and some days, though she is awake the whole night for emergency delivery, when we visit her in the morning for consultations, she will be with the same beautiful smile and positivity. She told us that this time we would hold our baby in our hands and it came true.

She was so particular and conscious enough that there were no chances of uncertainties by closely monitoring the pregnancy at more frequent intervals, giving us much needed moral support and strength, making us stay positive throughout.

Finally, the day arrived. The doctor informed us well in advance about the delivery process, and we were asked to get admitted. I was induced by night and Mam informed the duty doctors to keep monitoring the baby's heartbeat and to inform her about my status, and she assured me if there was any urgency she would be there in 5 mins in hospital. She was frequently checking on my status that night and the next morning, we were blessed with a little angel . In the labor room, she was so supportive. Her words made me feel better when I was in so much pain.

Pregnancy is definitely a smooth journey with a wonderful human being like Dr. Manjula Deepak Mam. I miss visiting Mam in the hospital. She is a very down-to-earth person, and she talks to you like your sister and friend. We can‚Äôt thank Mam enough for all her efforts. This is the shortest I could write about Mam.
reply_text: Thank you very much lavanya for your kind words it means a lot to me

review:
First of all, I would say a BIG THANK YOU to Manjula mam. She is among the best doctor in Obstetrics and Gynaecology and always tries for a normal delivery unless there is anything serious and does the best possible treatment. I recommend everyone to consult her without a second thought in mind.¬†Once you visit her, you will get to know that you are in a safe¬†and the¬†best hand and will never regret it.¬†

We are blessed with a baby through a normal delivery even after my wife was running on insulin since she got gestational diabetes at the end of 3rd month of pregnancy. I have a long story that I am going to describe¬†below which may be useful for others.

We had consulted Dr. Manjula Deepak first time after the completion of about 3 months of my wife's first pregnancy. Before this, we had consulted two more doctors in Bengaluru but were not satisfied because they¬†were not allowing husbands to talk to the doctor (I understand it was covid time, but still husbands should also meet the doctors), not describing everything in detail, and not answering all the question. We had many questions since it was the first pregnancy. I did google and found Dr. Manjula Deepak with many good reviews and decided to consult her.
Coming to our story, Our first baby was having multiple abnormalities which were identified by Dr. Manjula mam and her team (Dr. Kavyashree KS) at the time of the anomaly scan. It was very shocking for us¬†and hard to believe. But the doctor wanted to have a second opinion before taking any further steps because it was critical and referred us to Bangalore Fetal Medicine Centre (BFMC). We went to BFMC and found there were some patients having similar or another type¬†of criticality in their pregnancy¬†and were referred to BFMC for a second opinion from many well-known hospitals. Doctors in BFMC did an anomaly scan for my wife and they too found the same issue and suggested aborting the baby because it was not easy for the baby to survive in this world or there were high chances to have more complications in the future. BFMC doctors¬†explained the whole thing in more detail and answered all of our questions. We headed back to mam with the BFMC reports and she also suggested abortion and gave us time for a few days to make the final decision. In the meantime, I did some research on google, checked with some other sources, consulted families and friends, etc because it was not easy for us to abort our first baby and finally we decided to go with the doctor's suggestion. My wife got admitted and the doctor did an abortion. I saw the baby and it was the same as presented in the anomaly scan report. It was the most painful day of our life.¬†

We consulted Manjula mam after some days and were worried that will it be similar if we plan for the next child? She told us it happens sometimes and is very rare. She recommended planning for the next baby after three months and don't think much about these things. She gave us enough confidence to plan for the next baby and promised that she will be giving us a healthy baby this time and will take care of everything¬†from the beginning itself.

Good news came after eight or nine months and we consulted with Dr. Manjula mam and did whatever she suggested and continued consulting her. Everything went normal but after the completion of the 3rd month, my wife got Gestational Diabetes and the doctor told us that we should control¬†this until delivery by diet, physical activities, or insulin if required. Else it may impact the growth of the baby. Again we got shocked and trusted the doctor and followed her advice since we got¬†enough faith in her by this time. She referred us to a Dietician and an¬†Endocrinologist to control sugar levels. My wife did the same and was in observation¬†by her, Dietician, and Endocrinologist.¬†

Now the time came for the anomaly¬†scan and we visited the same doctor Kavyashree KS who was aware of our past. We were so much scared and were praying to god at the time of the scan. I thanked a lot¬†to god and the doctors when we got the report and felt very happy,¬†everything¬†was normal. We continued following up with the doctor and Endocrinologist.
At around the 7th month of pregnancy, we moved to another doctor (don't want to name her¬†here,¬†but I will refer to her¬†as ABC) due to some financial issues. Whenever¬†we consulted ABC, she use to give us a lot of tension, used to scare us and never thought about the normal delivery, and always¬†suggested¬†a C section, else there may be a risk for the baby. We continued consulting with ABC up to about the 9th month and were worried about the ABC's words she use to speak at the time of consultation, we were getting sleepless nights.¬†

Finally, we decided to consult Dr. Manjula Deepak again and went to her and explained¬†everything. She was too polite and understood our situation and convinced us that there is¬†nothing to worry about and everything is under control. She told me 95% of the chances are there that she will do a normal delivery and rest upon God (We too agreed here). I told her, mam do whatever you feel the best, I left everything to her and she was the next person after God for us.
Since my wife was on insulin due to Gestational Diabetes, Dr. Manjula mam had to plan delivery before the due date by inducing pain. We planned for this and did accordingly. Delivery was not very easy and that took so much effort from¬†mam's side. She was very calm and active during the whole process. There was a time when even I thought of saying the doctor to go for a C section, but I already had left everything on mam and was knowing that she will be performing her best and finally, we are blessed with a healthy baby. Tears came to my eyes and I thanked a lot¬†Dr. Manjula mam and God for blessing us with the baby.¬†

I am 100% sure that if it was any other doctor, definitely¬†it was done through a C section.

Now I am very happy with my kid and my wife!!! Again credit goes to Dr. Manjula mam!!!

review:
*** ******* ****** ** *** ** *** **** ************* ** ********** I am so happy that I decided to visit her for my pregnancy. She is very humble, caring, down to earth and would make you feel absolutely comfortable right from the very first visit. I must say, she's super beautiful too. 
My pregnancy journey was quite rough. This was also my first pregnancy. I had severe nausea/vomiting & heartburn since the start of my pregnancy due to which I faced severe gastric problems. Dr. Manjula would always reply to my queries on WatsApp almost immediately.  At times, late in the evening/ night i would require medical attention as I would go through terrible stomach pains. Dr.Manjula would answer my calls every time and patiently guide me. She would also call the duty doctor @cloudnine and instruct as to what needs to be done upon my arrival.

She guided me to get admitted to another hospital and was also in constant touch with the doctors there monitoring my medicines. By God's grace I recoverd and my baby was also fine in my womb.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
My wife (Arpita) has been seeing Dr Manjula since April this year from the very beginning of her pregnancy. We got to know about her pregnancy right in the middle of the National Lockdown. My wife was very tense because of the COVID situation at that point in time and we were unsure how things will pan out. We did an online check of various gynecologists and obstetricians across Bangalore on Practo and other websites and came across Dr Manjula‚Äôs profile. We were amazed at her rating (100%) with over 700 reviews. What was also incredible was that almost 80% of those who gave ratings shared their stories. We did not find any other gynecologist across Bangalore who had a 100% rating along with such high number of reviews. Even most of the renowned doctors had 97-98% rating but 100% rating was unheard of. We were quite curious and we decided to visit her, even though the Cloudnine HRBR branch where she is based is relatively far from our place. 
After first few visits, we slowly figured out the reasons for her perfect ratings. Dr Manjula came across as a very friendly, polite and patient person. But the thing that stands out about her is her relaxed attitude. She will put her patients at ease and remove all stress and tension. She does not prescribe any unnecessary tests or medicines and tries her best to ensure that the pregnancy follows a natural path. Throughout the pregnancy, my wife had frequent bouts of nausea and vomiting, but the doctor assured her that it was normal and not to be worried at all. She encourages positivity all the time. My wife had lot of questions (especially since it was her first pregnancy), but the doctor answered all of them patiently. She even gave her watsapp number. My wife used to get her doubts and queries clarified from time to time on watsapp and invariably the doctor would always reply in spite of her busy schedule. 
Couple of more things I would like to mention about Dr Manjula. She remembers all her patients by name (which I find quite incredible given that she would be meeting several new patients every week). Also, she has a very good rapport with her staff. She treats them and talks to them as her equal (just like talking to a friend). This is a rare quality and shows that she is humble, kind and has a great soul. I could see the kind of respect all the staff members had for her. 
In the middle of her pregnancy, my wife was thinking of going to her home town in Kolkata for couple of months. Doctor gave her the go ahead and also provided a fit to fly certificate. After 2 months just before my wife was expected to fly back, we had a discussion of whether the delivery should happen in Kolkata or Bangalore. However, we decided that it was best for her to come back mainly because of the confidence we had in Dr Manjula. After coming back, my wife underwent a CBC test and her hemoglobin came quite low (8.4). Dr Manjula suggested her to take 2 doses of iron infusion. After taking those doses, her hemoglobin went up to 11.2 in a month‚Äôs time. 
During the last scan, my wife was detected with polyhydramnios (very high levels of amniotic fluid) which occurs in just 1% pregnancies. We were quite worried on hearing this but Dr Manjula spent significant amount of time with us, calmed us down and assured us that my wife and our baby were in safe hands and there was nothing to worry. She suggested that we will need to go for Caesarian (because of the polyhydramnios) and it needed to be done within a week. She even gave us the option of choosing the date and time. She clarified all our doubts, laid to rest all our concerns and explained us the entire process of admission and operation. She also assured us that even if there was any emergency at any time before the day of operation, we could just walk in and get admitted and she will come over immediately (Dr Manjula stays just 5 minutes away from the hospital). We went back home satisfied. We chose the date and time of operation and intimated her. 
On 30th Nov on the day of the operation, we reached the hospital early in the morning. All admission formalities were done smoothly and within couple of hours my wife was all set for the operation. In the operation theatre, as my wife was being administered anesthesia, she started sobbing uncontrollably as she got a bit scared. The doctor immediately comforted her and helped her to calm down. Soon she lost consciousness. In the middle of the operation, my wife just remembers hearing the words ‚Äúits a sweet baby girl‚Äù. The operation went smoothly and baby was born healthy. 
When my wife was discharged after 3 days, she had mostly recovered. My wife recovered much faster compared to most people we know of. We believe strongly that this has more to do with the quality of her operation and doctor‚Äôs encouragement to start getting active at the earliest. Dr Manjula called us back after a week, removed the dressing (which had almost healed) and explained to us clearly the way forward. Our next visit is scheduled after 6 months. 
Overall we had an overwhelming experience with Dr Manjula and we would like to thank her from the bottom of our heart for her guidance, advise, encouragement and everything she has done for my wife throughout this period. Most importantly, we would like to thank her for delivering to us the best gift of our life. We will be eternally grateful to her.
reply_text: Thank you very much Anik and Arpita for your kind words it means a lot to me

From last few years we keep looking the reviews for best gynecologist‚Äôs and hospitals in Bangalore, finally we got to know about the Dr Manjula Ma'm and her positive feedbacks. we almost read about her all the reviews in google and practo, surprised to see 900 plus positive comments and everyone has different problems but still they happy with Manjula Ma'm treatment. For us time came to visit Manjula Ma'm in 2021 October and the first consultation experience was good.

We were having small issue during 7th month pregnancy and we are lucky enough to have Manjula Ma'm and she treated well in advance and everything went well. Being busy doctor, still she always available over the whatsapp/phone call and clarify even small query/concerns.

Having C-section first time, still Ma'm was positive for Normal on 2nd delivery and waited till 38th week to see if Normal is possible. Here is the situation shows how dedicated about her patients and profession, Ma'm was having some surgery for her throat on same day and she couldn't talk next 2 weeks of time :( and she discharged from hospital that day evening around 5.30PM. but still in that situation Ma'm came to hospital to see my wife around 8.30PM night and given great support (we worried after hearing her surgery and in that situation, what if another doctor attend how they treat and all. she has talked with her assistant doctor and asked her to wait till night and make sure we feel comfortable for safe delivery). she couldn't talk having surgery(it was one way communication and she clarified our quires on writing paper :) ) and still everything she was writing up on paper and prescribed what should do for that night and early morning. i don‚Äôt think any other doctor will available like this for patients especially when they have surgery for throat and situation where she can‚Äôt even talk anything. Whoever looking for best gynecologists, blindly you can go ahead with Dr Manjula and follow her instructions. You will be in very safe hands and will experience smooth delivery process.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,
review:
Wonder Woman

Wonder Woman 1984 movie was released in May 2021. It is a good movie. The movie, for those who have not seen it, is about a fictional DC character Diana Prince, An Amazonian with super natural powers and who saves the world. For us, real life Wonder Woman is, Dr. Manjula Deepak.

We are parents of 2 daughters (Vismaya and Vinyasa) both delivered by Dr. Manjula Deepak. 2 normal deliveries and we are 2 happy and grateful parents who want to share our experience so that others can just enjoy the parenthood and not worry about anything else in the world.

Dr. Manjula Deepak is real life Wonder woman. We don't have enough words to describe how grateful we are to Dr. Manjula. Both of our daughters were delivered by Dr. Manjula in Cloud 9 HRBR Layout. First one in March 2019 and second one during COVID times May 2021.

When you are about to become parents for the first time, you have a lot of questions, some fears; what would happen if the water broke at midnight to is our baby doing well, is mother eating properly to why is baby not kicking from last 2-3 days, what to eat and what exercises to do during these days; what to expect during the delivery. You will get all the answers and more. She is extremely patient and listens to you and helps out even to internet/google research parents, which we were :). She is so friendly that you would be quite comfortable. She always has a smile which puts you at ease and you feel like she is a family member.

Our first baby,
She accommodated consultation timings as we were travelling from Electronic City to HRBR layout; sometimes 2 hours of travel in Bangalore traffic but we didn't want any other doctor. She suggested exercise, medicine, diet changes which we followed religiously. She also answered our queries on WhatsApp. The delivery was induced as babies growth was sufficient and normal delivery would be tricky if we waited more. The water broke in mid-night. We called Dr. Manjula and she immediately picked the call at 2AM! She said don't worry, just come. We felt so comfortable, although the labour was 9 hours, she was there to reassure that it is going to be fine. She wanted us to have normal delivery and it was. We delivered a healthy baby weighing 2.8 kgs.

Our second baby, it was during COVID-19 Wave 2,
We both tested positive for COVID-19 in 8th month of pregnancy, the consultations, scans were difficult as the COVID protocol won't let the husbands along in the scan room and our first daughter would cry thinking the doctors are doing something to mom. The second delivery was also planned. Although the labour was 12 hours, we delivered normally, a healthy baby weighing 3.2 kgs.
After the delivery, when we come back to senses, she visits you and takes selfies with tired but happy parents!

She is super busy as everyone wants time from her, but she makes sure you get enough attention and care.
She probably would skip lunch for your appointments and for deliveries which can happen in middle of lunches.
She would skip sleeping at night but makes sure she is available when you need her for the delivery in middle of the night with a big smile. You and I can probably do this for a week or so, but to do this every day and every night is super human thing. she is a great doctor and a great human being.


About the hospital where she consults, Cloud 9 HRBR:
- The canteen food is excellent. Might not get your favourite smoothies but the fruit juices are healthy; you might not get chicken biriyani but the meals are filling, neatly prepared, hygienic and healthy. Canteen staff are very courteous.
- Some of the nurses might be new and less experienced but they are quite helpful, senior nurses are definitely knowledgeable and kind.
- The rooms are clean and well maintained, they have proper ACs, bathrooms and sufficient space for baby and parents.
- The Bangalore traffic could be bad to reach the hospital due to one ways and road repairs but as deliveries were planned, we didn't have this issue. Parking is nice.

One would have more babies if the delivery is this smooth. If words only could express how much gratitude we feel for Dr. Manjula Deepak, we would have written a book. There aren't enough stars to rate her .... seriously she is Wonder woman. 

Sapthami and Vijesh.
reply_text: Thank you very much sapthami and Vijesh for your kind words it means a lot to me

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: My storytime was long pending. I conceived way back in April 2016 and there was no HBR cloud nine then it was only Cloudnine clinic at Kammanhalli. when I missed my periods I rushed to cloud nine clinics was my test result was positive. I had no lead in terms of doctor I checked with the staff of cloud nine and they immediately suggested a Doctor who was available then that was the start point of my nightmare, during my first visit I asked her about do's and dont's and never got any answer I felt lost, I had morning sickness or 24/7 throwing up sickness for the first couple of months one of such days when I was throwing up rigorously I started coughing blood and when I tried reaching the doctor through Clinic she never spoke to me but gave instructions even without listening to me properly. When i went again for my visit i had lost considerable amount of weight which is not good during pregnancy and i was put on alternate days vitamins injection which was painful, somehow i go through this as well and reached my next check up by then there was no improvement in my weight instead it had gone from bad to worse, I was put another rounds of injections which was 2 times a day for a week, On third day when the doc in my area was not able to find the nerve to poke injection i went back to clinic which was on a weekday, nurse there felt bad looking at my condition and referred DR MANJULA DEEPAK my saviour my god i would say she was very polite when i met her and her first question to me was if i were comfortable to converse in Kannada and I was more than happy to articulate my feeling my questions my fears in my language i was asked immediately to stop those injections and she told me just eat regular home made food and you will be fine and apart from the regular Iron and calciums pills no other medicines are required and from then till my delivery i would always be excited to meet Doctor Manjula like a kid she would listen to me with all patience in the world. I would generally take the first appointment of the day and later go to work from there on one such instance during my appointment it was a working day and I had my appointment a little later than my regular day and she asked if I had off and I told her my team is on offsite she looked from my file and asked why didn't you go? I was like isn't it obvious she told me YOU ARE PREGNANT, NOT PATIENT. She had given her number in case of emergency, While my pregnancy journey with Doctor Manjula was great after my delivery at Cloudnine Malleswaram my son had miconium aspiration and he was in NICU for 10 days his lungs had collapsed and during this time though Dr Manjula had given discharge clearance her duty ended but she would visit me every other day from Cloudnine old airport road or after her consulting time in Cloudnine Kammanhalli even if there were no delivery for her in Malleswaram Unit on that particular day one of those days i felt extremely emotional seeing everyone coming for delivery and leaving within a day or 2 with their babies and here i was crying looking at my baby attached with tubes, I called her started crying over the phone she consoled me around 12:30 in the midnight she comes to my ward after finishing a delivery at airport road because i was feeling low i never felt so touched, she personally went to NICU checked all the reports of my baby and made me understand what is the progress in layman term and tells me tomorrow hopefully they should call you to breastfeed the baby and next day i get call around afternoon asking to come over for feeding my baby was tubes free.. she visited me every alternative days till i was in the hospital for almost 10+ days and helped me recover mentally ... I am getting emotional as i type this today if my son is happy and healthy the entire credit goes to my doctor Manjula Deepak and its just not this a year or 2 back i had UTI at middle of night and i was in not town i was at night somewhere pain was unbearable i didn't know if she would remember me i called her she picked my phone saying " Hey Ramya how are you ?" that was my first relief and immediately i told her this she suggested few medicines i went in search of a pharmacy and got the medicine n survived that night just before COVID I suddenly spotted blood in my panty soon after my periods days and i was tensed ( thanks to the google symptoms) i like always called her and she calmly told me stop over thinking and if you still not convinced come over to meet me i ran for my life and there she told me the reason for it and took me to scan room herself and was present the entire time holding my hand ... THIS IS HER... nicest most humble and down to earth person, I wish i can imbibe few of her qualities... THANKS, A TONNNN Doctor

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
We have only good things to say about Dr. Manjula Deepak. we started consulting her from our 2nd trimester and right from the start we thought this doc is exactly who we wanted. Reasons are simple and I would like to specifically call it out as below and rate it for those who are now in a similar situation like how we were when we really wanted the best doc for us.

¬∑        Friendliness: my rating is 5 out of 5

One of the friendliest doc we have come across. She has this knack of easing out the pressure and stress with you generally would associate with during pregnancy. She makes you feel comfortable and the consultations are generally fun.

 

¬∑        Professionalism, Treatment: my rating is 5 out of 5

We found her a thorough professional and always available for the patients. She always quickly understood or diagnosed issues things became so much easy for us and we were confident that come what may, she is going to find a solution. There are specific things that happened and we were quite worried and had even gone to a couple of docs who we thought would be able to help and this was after the delivery, but then we finally decided to go back to Dr Manjula and like a snap of your fingers she diagnosed the issue and gave a solution. She believes in prescribing very minimum medicines and we were very happy with that too. One point I would like to specially mention is that I found her ability to remember names of everyone she meets is amazing and she makes it a point to stop and talk to all her patients whenever and wherever she meets them in the premises and correctly addresses everyone by their name. She might be really stressed out after her night shifts and multiple procedures but it never really shows up on her face when she meets you.

 

¬∑        Accessibility: 5 out of 5

During your pregnancy, you would really want someone to be reachable 24/7 and for the smallest and silliest of things. Dr Manjula is just a msg or phone call away and that is so comforting and definitely made things really smooth and easy for us

 

¬∑        Cost: 4 out of 5

The cost bit, I am rating 4 as I quite didn‚Äôt agree with the increase in consulting fees by Cloudtail during Covid. I understand the costs were increased to accommodate the additional expenses the hospital needs to bear for the various kits that is supposedly needed by the doctors to meet the patients.

 

Overall, we would give a 5 out of 5 to Dr Manjula Deepak and would definitely and certainly recommend her to anyone who is looking to have a good pregnancy and delivery experience. We were lucky enough to have found her

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
We ( Jeshma & Sunil) visited Dr. Manjula Deepak for pregnancy checkup at Cloudnine (HRBR Layout Branch) after going through the reviews of couple of doctors online and were delighted & confident on our choice the very first day we met her. Yes, her energetic, positive & consoling nature will not allow anyone to look for an alternative for pregnancy needs throughout their life. Our very first consultation with her for ~10-15 min left us talking about her commendable qualities for the rest of the day. I personally love her calling my Wife's name (Jeshmaa....) which will give you a friendly feel even before getting into her cabin for consultation. She was clear & precise in conveying my Wife's pregnancy status from time to time and was appreciating my wife for maintaining her health & weight pretty consistently although you can find her being strict at times when you end up showing some variance in the expected numbers. Our consultation with her throughout my Wife's pregnancy was very positive & promising. Despite having all the conditions in our favor for normal delivery until the 37th week, the doctor wasn't happy about her pelvis type which hinted the fact that we should be prepared to go for C-section if normal isn't possible due to the suspected issue.

However, when we hit the big day (D-day), it was a great & out of the world experience to us. My wife started getting light pain around 12:45AM and eventually it increased and had to admit her in the hospital at 6:30AM. They induced labor around 7:30AM and asked us to wait until 11:30AM after which the doctor inspected the condition and noticed that the baby has passed motion so wanted to speed up the delivery process but my Wife was not fully dilated yet and she couldn't bear the pain anymore. That's when the doctor played her role very decisively by talking to me personally and stating that everything is on-track & going great than expected. The only demand from her side was to convince my wife to bear the pain for another 60-90 min in order to have normal delivery & she made her team to continuously monitor the baby's heartbeat & was waiting for the right time for normal delivery. Finally, she was fully dilated within 90 min and the doctor with her entire labor team did a great job by delivering the baby successfully through normal delivery process after which I couldn't resist myself from giving the doctor a big hug.

Overall, Dr. Manjula Deepak is a god sent angel for us who did all that she can do to deliver our cute little angel through the normal delivery process. All the preparation, pain & efforts paid off and we reveled in the miracle of birth. Thanks a lot to the doctor and her entire crew who played their role meticulously to make our baby's birth an unforgettable experience. We will certainly recommend Dr. Manjula Deepak & the Cloudnine hospital for all sort of pregnancy & maternity needs.

Thanks & Regards,
Sunil, Jeshma & Unnamed Angel
reply_text: Thank you very much Sunil and jeshma for your kind words it means a lot to me

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
We were so happy when we knew that my wife was Pregnant, we were excited and scared at the same time as it was her first pregnancy. 

As a couple we had a huge list of recommendations from friends and relatives about various doctors we could consult. 

Our first and foremost requirement at the time was to find a warm and caring doctor that we were comfortable with. 

One by one we visited 7 doctors (some with an Attitude, some with a prescription for various scans within 2min of meeting and also from a particular Lab and a Particular Technician, some wouldn‚Äôt allow the Husband in the consulting room, some speak only Medical jargons makes it so difficult to follow, some scare you that its going to be a caesarean on the first visit) and finally we met Dr Manjula Deepak.

After the first interaction with Dr Manjula my wife was so happy and so excited and was so confident in saying that she is going to be our doctor, though the Hospital was never on our list (it was on the higher end ‚Çπ compared to other Hospitals), the whole day I just heard from my wife that the doctor was like this, like that, she told this, she said don‚Äôt worry, she was not in a hurry, she answered all my queries etc‚Ä¶

When you meet Dr Manjula, she is full of Energy, Positivity, Compassionate, Warm, speaks to you in the most humble and simplified manner, like speaking to a child. What one expects from a doctor apart for their expertise is that feel, that when u meet a doctor that everything is going to be fine, she will be there when you need her, she will comfort you when you are in pain, she will move any obstacles in your way, and all you have to do is rest your faith in her hands.

We have never felt that a scan was prescribed unnecessarily, that a Blood test was prescribed unnecessarily, that a medicine was prescribed unnecessarily. She has always ensured that only the required Treatment was provided.

She was available on the phone whenever you have a query (big or small), though she is almost always the busiest doctor in the Hospital 24x7 (Consult her once and you will know what i mean).

On the Final day we were at the Hospital at 10pm in the LDR, by then Dr Manjula had instructed the fellow doctors about the next steps, she visited us at 11 in the night (prior to this we only met her in the morning) and comforted us and mentioned we had time and that she will be back the next morning at 7am. We were waiting in the room that night, Dr Manjula comes in the room at 4am she happened to be there as another patient of hers delivered, she was there to check and left after sometime, only to return at 6 am to again check on us, this time we were worried, as my wife wasn‚Äôt responding to the Treatment, she politely told us to wait till 9 am. And then she returned and still my wife wasn‚Äôt responding to the Treatment, they tried inducing pain but it was all but clear that we have to prepare ourselves for a caesarean, we had time only till 1pm for a Normal delivery. So we waited and suddenly at 12 the doctors hurried to the room, called Dr Manjula, it was time, all the doctors encouraged, cajoled, reminded that it was all in my wife‚Äôs hands for a Normal delivery. Can still hear Dr Manjula shouting that ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to do a caesarean, you had come to me months ago asking for a Normal delivery, now you need to push, you are so close, please push‚Äù.

It‚Äôs a boy, he was delivered normally. It was an ordeal for us for almost 14 hours but all through, Dr Manjula was right there‚Ä¶

She was there every step of the way till the most crucial time, supporting, helping, guiding and by the Grace of God we have Dr Manjula as our Doctor. As a Husband a brother a friend and a fellow human being I would always recommend that you get a doctor as good as Doctor Manjula Deepak‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
My husband and I was pregnant with our first child. We researched for a good gynecologist and came across Dr Manjula's profile in practo. With all the good stories shared we decided to consult her and I would say that was the best decision we made for our pregnancy journey.

She has a very charismatic personality with full of energy and positive attitude. In our first visit, being a first timer, we had a lot of questions. To our surprise we got answers to all of them without asking. This shows her rich experience in dealing with the subject where she understands the mindset of new going to be parents. And the same happened in our every visit. She gave all the information required for the time without we worrying to ask. And she was always available on whatsapp for any emergency query.
Another thing which was very impressive about her was that she doesn‚Äôt prescribes any fancy procedure or medicine. She suggests all the natural ways and procedures, natural homely remedies , homely supplements etc. On the medicine front too, i was never loaded with a lot of tests and tablets. I had a very smooth and happy pregnancy. 
There was a point where we were thoughts of going to our hometown for helping hands during COVID. But it was just and just for the doctor and our confidence on her that we stayed back. And we are very happy with our decision.
We wanted NVD and again it was for the doctor that we were able to achieve it. My labor was long where at a point we broke down and was thinking of going for C-section. But doctor Manjula showed high confidence and kept convincing us to wait for a little longer. Finally, i delivered a healthy baby normally. She supported me though post delivery period too where i was very nervous about recovery of my mind and body. 
Her AURA is magical. Meeting her always made me happy even in my lowest of mood a 5-minute chat with her made me relaxed and feel better.
During COVID where cloudnine only allows one parent to enter the hospital/doctor's cabin , she made sure my husband was involved equally in the journey. She spoke to my husband over phone/virtually in our every visit and kept him updated with all the progress our baby was making. 
A great doctor, a beautiful soul and above all a great human being. I highly highly appreciate and recommend her. She is a full package of great subject expertise and amazing consulting skills, she was everything I wanted from my gynecologist. 
Doctor Manjula, may you always be super gorgeous, super fit and kicking . You will always stay in my heart. God bless you !!

review: Basis on the Google review , I went to consult with doctor Manjula Deepak.  As this was my first pregnancy I was unsure whom to consult. I'm still not sure of these reviews are true or are all false. When I met her as a person she was really nice to talk , she kept a smile on her face and answered all the queries. All my reports were normal . She advised me with few exercise for having normal delivery and I religiously abide by her instructions. I was very happy thinking my doctor understands me and she is also trying for normal delivery.  I was very close to my due date which was on 10th of Feb but unfortunately  I did not get my labour , I became very worried and went to doctor. I was asked to do a scan to check the water level and to see if everything was fine. Thankfully everything came as normal. I checked with the doctor if she can induce but she refused and asked me to relax and go home and wait for the normal labour. I waited and waited for the normal labour  but unfortunately It did not happen, but I made sure basis on the dates given by the doctor I visited her with no fail. Now I was 42 weeks pregnant. Every one was worried home because according to them it was very late but thankfully doctor Manjula Deepak gave me the confidence nothing to worry. Finally I got a little pain and decided to admit in the hospital (cloud nine) at night 6 pm on Sunday while she was feeding her babies. She asked me to leave and get admited on Monday as on Sunday there are only limited staff. As I was very worried because of my past due date I became reluctant to go back. She arrived on at 8pm and decided to break the water and immediately decided to take me for c section  **** ** **** ******* I was absolutely fine till than. I was so shocked as they started giving me injection and took my signature and took in the OT ,And send my husband to pay the bill by the time he came back I was given the anesthesia in my spine. *** ***** ***** *** ****** *** **** *** **** *** **** *** ******* *** ****** ****  With in few minutes she finished the surgery and rushed home ** *** ****** *** **** **** ****** * *** ********** ** * ******* ********* *** **** ********* **** ******** ***** She didn't even come to meet me post surgery.*** ******* *** *** **** ***** * *** ********** ***** ** *** ***** ** *********  I have very bad   back  pain. ** **** ** ********** ****** *** * ***** **** ** **** I have a constant pain in my back. tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I could plan a second child just to be under Dr. Manjula Deepak's care! :)  I think this gives you an absolutely clear idea of my trust, respect and admiration for this passionate and highly experienced individual. You will see the same respect in the eyes of the people who work with her too.

I met Dr. Manjula Deepak at Cloudnine Hospital in HRBR when I was 4 weeks pregnant and was recommended by a friend ( PS: she is extremely popular amongst her past patients and rightly so.).

My first consultation with Dr. Manjula Deepak allowed me to experience her positive and energetic nature. She is so passionate and thorough that she remembers more about you than you do about your own case. She understands the anxiety levels of the mom-to-be and responds on messages for any queries. 

I remember, I had a dicey first trimester which made me really anxious, low and under-confident but every time I would meet doctor she gave me so much confidence and hope. Most importantly, I always wanted to have a normal delivery and when I was 3 cm dilated, doctor sat me and my husband down to explain the process of delivery and comforted us. She patiently waited and encouraged me for a normal delivery till the end (yes, through 12 hours of labor!), she ensured that I was absolutely comfortable during the labor and took precious time from her busy schedule to bring our baby into this world via normal delivery.

I still remember what she told me when I was 10 weeks pregnant ‚Äì ‚ÄúI will give you a baby, don‚Äôt worry‚Äù and boy she did :) We were blessed with a baby boy this May, filling our life with abundance and happiness for which we are extremely grateful to her..

One thing I absolutely love about her is she is very honest and tells you like it is. During my pregnancy, she encouraged me to have a healthy weight gain (which most doctors don‚Äôt really care about much) and whenever I would waiver from the track set for me by the nutritionist she would tell me that its not going to help me or my goal of normal delivery and kept me focused.  Thanks to her advice and encouragement I am already 2 kgs away from my pre-pregnancy weight, Yay!

Finally, she is someone I look upto as her passion is infectious and something we could all imbibe. Every time I cross cloud nine or go to cloud nine for my baby‚Äôs consultation, my eyes keep searching for her. She still remembers my name even after all this time and always offers her warm smile and banter whenever I greet her. She is an amazing human being and an extra ordinary doctor in this field where most are looking to mint money! 

I highly highly recommend Dr. Manjula Deepak if you are looking to bring a little one into your lives :)

context: Pregnancy Check Up,Normal Vaginal Delivery (NVD),Pre and Post Delivery Care,
review:
Me and my wife are writing this review with a deep gratitude in our heart for Dr Manjula Deepak for her support and guidance throughout the pregnancy journey. 

We were consulting a different Gynec initially and we had an emergency, but did not get a satisfying response when we wanted an advise. So, I did reach out to my close friend who were also expecting a baby for his suggestion for a good Gynec. He referred us to Dr Manjua Deepak and that‚Äôs where our journey started, which turned out to be an amazing decision of choosing her. I am so thankful to my friend too for doing so. 

Am sure, this review will help many such couples who can just walk up to Dr Manjula without any second thought and they will have a similar experience.

1.	Firstly, she is so friendly that at your first visit you feel so comfortable. She listen to your problems and comforts us by assuring that the problem is handled at ease, which is an amazing quality as a Doctor

2.	From the first visit itself we had gained confidence that we felt we are in safe hands

3.	My wife had to undergo a Cyst surgery when she was in her start of 3rd month of pregnancy and we both were so tensed but she had assured everything to be fine with the baby and rightly by the grace of god everything was fine

4.	We were always given a heads-up on upcoming symptoms/ body changes which helped my wife to be mentally ready

5.	Whatever the Scan reports say, she has never created a panic mode in us, which is so great of her

6.	She was available on WhatsApp for any kind of emergency (Suggest not to message a Doctor unless it is an emergency)

7.	My wife preferred a normal delivery, but due to situation we ended up deciding for C-section a day before she delivered. But Dr Manjula just walked up to the Labour room that night and comforted and gave assurance for a normal delivery irrespective of the situation which made us to re-think on our decision and agreed for Normal delivery. She proved that she was right which made us so happy

8.	Our baby was early by 5 weeks, doctor had to deliver the baby at 34 weeks. It was not a surprise for us, as doctor had hinted this right from 5th month of pregnancy and was monitoring closely. We were in a much better position because of her positivity and assurance. 

9.	It was such a great feeling to see my baby next to my wife within an hour of delivery

10.	Never seen a doctor be so committed towards their patients 

Words fall short enough to appreciate the service you do. You have been a great human being first and doctor next. Thank you for all your service, you will be remembered always by both of us and our family. Wishing you greater heights and success in your carrier :-) 


Mithun Somaiah & Divya
