tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: This comes a little late but here is my note of my journey with Dr. Manjula Deepak. I thank God for having given me the best doctor who like an angel so wonderfully saw me through the whole process of having a baby. Dr. Manjula was my second doctor whom I consulted for my cyst and enquire about having a baby as my husband and I were planning for a baby. My husband and I had planned to meet another doctor in the same hospital but by Gods grace we got directed to meet Dr. Manjula. Initially I was very nervous and skeptical about our first visit. Meeting her in person instantly made us feel so welcomed and the conversation was so friendly and yet professional. Talking to her about my condition and the concerns I had was so comfortable, I felt for the first time that someone truly heard me out and understood my condition. The counseling she offered encouraged us and made us feel so optimistic about having a baby very soon despite my cyst. I truly enjoyed my follow up visits, doctor was so friendly and taught me to take things positively and to enjoy the process and assured me time and again not to worry. Those visits truly boosted my spirit and lifted hopes up. By the end of my third follow up checkup I had totally forgotten about my cyst condition because I that hopeful and knew I was heading in the right direction to having a baby. Per her guidance and medication, I began to follow them strictly. Dr. Manjula assured that within 3 months I can get conceived and per her word I got conceived with my first baby. Post pregnancy, we had timely and meaningful visits and through the process doctor took time to explain each phase of my pregnancy and kept us informed about our babys growth. Her medications and guidance was more than sufficient for both me and the baby. What I really appreciate is the passion Dr. Manjula has in her job, not many doctors come forward like her to go the extra mile to assure wellness of both the mother and the baby. I felt so secure and safe through every phase. Even if I couldnt consult face to face, she was always reachable over WhatsApp or phone call to enquire any concerns or recommend medication. Eventually in my visits to Dr. Manjula, I became so accustomed, we would wait to meet her again. Despite her busy schedule she is so hospitable and knows how to accommodate her patients and always treated us with so much respect and care. She kept us informed of what was upcoming and how I should respond to them, by that I was never too anxious for anything in the process. Some of the nurses also mentioned about how Dr. Manjula was looking forward to meet me and kept a tab on how I was doing. Even at the point of delivery, she took so much care that she even was willing to deliver my baby separately. She helped me to be prepared mentally and physically for what was going to happen during delivery. She ensures that both of us as husband and wife are present and kept my husband informed of how he can aid and support me. She took the time to be there to induce the pain for me herself and promised me that 99% everything is going to be good and we neednt worry. Doctor told that I should deliver the baby between 4am to 7am, but by Gods grace my baby started to come earlier. I was so surprised and felt so safe that at a moments notice she came over and had my baby delivered safely at 2.43am. God helped me deliver a beautiful baby boy. Both my husband and I and our families are filled with so much of joy and have a deep respect for our doctor simply because of the way we were calm and confident as Dr. Manjula always encouraged and helped us be confidant in everything, every concern we might have she clarified it right away and never was tired with our questions . I really hope and pray that many more doctors like Dr. Manjula will rise and be a blessing to many individuals and their families. I would recommend no other doctor but Dr. Manjula, I am totally confident that she will do her best to instill hope in mothers like me and help them bring up a baby. What I looked for the most was to have a normal delivery and not go for cesarean, Dr. Manjula stands for normal delivery and only when it is unavoidable she goes for cesarean. Dr. Manjula right from the start prepared us mentally and always pushed us to go for normal despite the pain. We need doctors like this, as cesarean might ease the pain at the moment but women suffer with back pain lifelong. Dr. Manjula ensured we have a normal delivery and I am so happy today that God sent us such a wonderful doctor. I recommend Dr. Manjula at Cloudnine Hospital HRBR layout. Just one appointment with her and I assure you will not be disappointed. Truly words cannot contain the gratitude I have for Dr. Manjula but I will always remember her and her family in my prayers and always be grateful to her. Thank you Dr. Manjula for your amazing service, truly you are the best in your job! I will miss the regular visits, hopefully will see you soon for our second baby. Thank you so much Dr. Manjula. Best Wishes and Warm Regards from Lilly Sophia and Godwin.

review:
I am fortunate to have had Dr. Manjula Deepak as Gynaec specialist for my wife. Way back in 2018-19, 5 Years back she had helped us to become proud parents of our sweet and beloved little princess. She has helped us become parents for the second time now that too with twins. Thanks to Dr. Manjula for her demonstration of due diligence and her guidance towards our successful and most memorable phase of attaining parenthood. We are now blessed with twin baby boys both in their best of health and weight. She is awesome as a doctor, especially in placing the right focus on each of her patients. Surprisingly, as not to be seen in most of the doctors, she diligently remembers each detail of the health conditions of her patients, their medications, their allergies and follow-up dates, etc. Apart from a great doctor, Dr. Manjula is a great soul as well who aims at serving the society with her best possible efforts and capacity. She is right there when there is a need may it be any part of the  midnight or day time. Really perplexed to see the way she manages between her consultations and delivery cases effectively without injustice to either. She visits the scan rooms personally many times to ensure proper understanding on the case. Also, I would not forget mentioning the way she explains and encourages her patients to make them aware of some of the treatments/procedures like cervical encirclage etc and helps take right decisions during the course of pregnancy - Only to ensure the best for her patients.  This, to a great extent helps towards the very high success rates that she delivers. Another great thing that we have noticed in Dr. Manjula 
 is the result-oriented & efficient planning that she does. I am grateful to the Almighty God that he connected us with this awesome doctor. She is also available on messaging apps/platforms for quick doubts/clarifications, which is one of the greatest assets of consulting with her.

Overall, I would definitely suggest/insist my friends/colleagues to Dr. Manjula Deepak without a second choice !

Along with Dr. Manju Deepak, I am thankful to cloudnine & the staff who stood with us in every step to ensure that we achieve parent-hood gracefully !!

All The Best and may God bless you,
TRS & Uzma

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
*****"An Angel was born in our life with the blessings of an Angel"******

Hi all,
We visited Manjula mam after 3 abortions, which used to happen within 2‚Äì3 months of conceiving. We went with our friend's reference, but we were having not even 10% of confidence of giving birth to a child, but she has (Manjula Mam). 
First thing she did was cutting off all overdosed medicines which my wife use to take (obviously suggested by other doctors) and bring down it to one tablet that is Folic. Guess what, very next month my wife conceived naturally without any external medical aid.
We went to Manjula madam, and she was very cautious at our initial stages till we complete 3 months. But let me tell you one thing, there were no extra medicines given to my wife except madam giving us confidence (She used to tell us nothing is going to happen until she is there for us).
Yes, Finally we completed 38 Weeks, that too without any overdosed medicines and steroids.
Guess what, My wife gave birth to a beautiful little angel on March 3rd which we never expected in our dreams also.(That too normal delivery)
The best part about Manjula madam is she is confident and very patient to listen to you, at the same time she expects you to listen to her and follow what she says. 
Sometimes she might be rude when you gain extra weight or when you increase your blood sugar level, but this is all about her concern about you.
She prefers doing normal delivery and never ever force you, or you force her for C-Section (My wife bore 12 Hours of labor pain, but Madam was very confident that she is going to make it as normal one, now we are realizing the Importance of normal delivery in our postnatal).
Finally, I can say thanks to madam for making us parents which we never dreamed of.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
context: Normal Vaginal Delivery (NVD),Pre and Post Delivery Care,Labor and Delivery,Pregnancy Check Up,Pregnancy,
review:
We (Wife & Me) visited Dr. Manjula Deepak after being highly recommended by one of our friends, and also after reviewing her on Practo. It was one of the best decisions of our life.
Not only did Dr. Manjula meet our expectation, but went above and beyond. We visited her from Day 1 and stuck to her till the day the baby was born and consulted her even for post pregnancy care.
From Day 1 Dr. Manjula looked after us like we were her family, she acclimated to us very well and made us feel comfortable right from the get go.
We visited her multiple times throughout our pregnancy journey, and each time after the meet we walked away with greater confidence & repose.

We were hellbent on getting a normal delivery and had stated that to the doctor on the very first day as well, the doctor asked us to rest easy and not worry about the delivery now and just to pay attention on the mother and Fetus.
Ultimately the result was a Normal Delivery, led by the very capable hands of Dr. Manjula Deepak :)
The labor for my wife was a long and strenuous one, it lasted for around 16 Hours, there was a scare of going to C Section as well, apart from that there was a condition called "Caput" for my Baby (Where the baby's head gets elongated because the baby has been stuck in the vaginal cavity for long). Though all these complication & Obstacles, Dr. Manjula helped us deliver the baby through Normal Vaginal Delivery, a tremendous feat !!!

If i had to describe Dr. Manjula Deepak through a few adjectives, they would be - 
1. Uber Responsible
2. Ferociously Passionate 
3. Fervently Energetic
4. Work ethic of an Ox
5. Acute Knowledge & expertise
6. Affable, Approachable & always Available for her patients (24/7 by Whats App)
7. An earnest personality

When it is all said and done, we only have the fondest of memories and deepest of respect towards Dr. Manjula Deepak, she really is a Godsend ! 

If we were to ever plan for another baby, I would love for Dr. Manjula Deepak to be our Doctor again.

And for people looking to choose a Doctor to walk them through their Pregnancy Journey, Look no further - I would suggest Dr. Manjula Deepak 100%.

PS -Thank you Dr. Manjula Deepak for showing your love, dedication & Hard work in helping us getting our beautiful son to this world :)

Thanks,
Ajay Ravinder & Ramya Gopal

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
context: Pregnant Women Counseling,Maternal Care/ Checkup,Pre and Post Delivery Care,
review:
It's a very late review [delivered in Nov'19 :-)] but I really didn't wanted to not post it for such an amazing doctor. 

We came to know about Manjula Deepak along with few other doctors, while we were browsing through good gynos nearby. However, were confused of which doctor to choose, somehow we gave it a go to meet Dr. Manjula Deepak, purely by looking at the reviews on Practo. 
But the day we met her, myself and my husband both were super impressed with her friendliness and the way she explained  everything. No confusion from there, decided to stick to her till the delivery.
Things which impressed us is, when we informed the doc about the travelling plan (when I was in my 6th week) which was planned well before conceiving, she did agree to it but proactively did the scan to check my sack. Also a scan was done by her upon my return too, to see if everything is fine.. And there are many such instances..
Almost at the end of my pregnancy, that's when I was in my 38th week, the scan did show that the baby's weight is little more than the average Indian babies. She immediately took the call to go for delivery in the same week, so as to try best for vaginal birth, since I had no complications and active throughout. 
The day I got admitted to the hospital, it was 10PM and there she was just in 15mins to check me. She was available at 4 in the morning over the call. Again by 7AM in the hospital to check her admitted patients (to be mom's). 
And there again by 9AM for her regular OPD and deliveries. I was awestruck to see the same enthusiasm throughout. 
Finally, we gave up on normal and took a call to go with C-Sec, there was my boy with 3 rounds of cord around his neck. 
If she hadn't adviced on the 38th week and if we were waiting for another 2 weeks for the delivery, have no idea how the situation would've turned out to be. My boy came out safe and all healthy. All thanks to the doctor. 
She is truly an angel, in my mom's words "Devathe" :-) 

This is from Vidhya and Harsha -Thank you very much doctor and sorry about the delayed review, typing it at 5 in the morning as my days are super busy with the kiddoüôÇ

But all these confusions just vanished after the first visit to Dr. Manjula and that turned out to be the amazing decision that we chose her. :) 

Hope this review helps others who are in search of a Good gynecologist who is in confusion just like I was... So just Jotting down the best points why I would recommend Dr. Majula to others without writing a big essay

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
I have consulted with Dr Manjula Deepak for a period of almost a year. Started with pre-pregnancy consultation and the doctor saw me through all the way till I delivered my twins last month.

Dr Manjula is one of the most friendly and reassuring doctors that I have consulted with. Her cheery attitude and confidence are very comforting. With a twin pregnancy, I started off being very scared - both about how my body would handle it and for the wellbeing of the babies. The doctor was extremely reassuring at all times. She never prescribed excessive medicines. In fact, she discouraged me from getting unnecessary scans / tests and stuck to fairly simple ground rules for the entire pregnancy. Unlike in a number of other twin pregnancy stories I have heard, she permitted me to travel in my second trimester and encouraged me to remain active through most of my pregnancy. She always set realistic expectations. What could otherwise have been a challenging time was made much easier because of her approach. 

The doctor spent a considerable amount of time during each consultation explaining matters well and going over scans with us carefully. She usually preempted most questions we had and was always available on phone for any follow up doubts / problems I had. On two occasions, she rushed to the hospital because I was facing discomfort - on the second occasion, she delivered my beautiful twins :) 

Even with the decision of whether to go for a natural delivery of a c-section, and during the actual surgery, the doctor was very informative and caring. This went a long way in making me feel comfortable and in control. One instance is that right before I was taken for the surgery, she remembered that I was very scared of injections and asked the anesthetist to personally insert the tube for the IV so that I would be caused minimal pain and discomfort.  It made me feel like I was in very good hands - which I certainly was!

I am extremely grateful to the doctor for her support. Most of all, since I have a tendency to stress a lot, it really helped that she balanced it off with her reassuring and kind approach. I recommend the doctor highly.

review: We visited Dr. Manjula Deepak during my wife's pregnancy and I must admit that she was no less than a blessing in our lives. In January 2020, my wife was pregnant and we were overwhelmed with the news, we were all happy until she was 12 weeks after a few blood tests (double marker) the doctors from other hospitals informed us that the test shows high risk (Its high level is indicative to a higher risk of Trisomy 18 and Down's syndrome) unfortunately all this was happening during the pandemic and the lockdown. I and my wife visited more than 3 to 4 hospitals and every time it was disappointing. few doctors also advised us to abort and to not take any chances that is when we were introduced to DR Manjula Deepak through my wife's friend. The first day we met her we realized we were in right place and the safe hands. Oh my god, what a personality i have never seen a doctor like her in my life and I am not exaggerating the passion she has towards her profession, the way she communicates with her patients, the confidence she gives to the family members of the patients. she is available round the clock and you can ask her any doubts any time she answers it without losing her cool. review:
Dr.Manjula is truly a God sent gift to the field of gynaecology and I can say this with 1000% confidence. My wife and I started visiting Dr.Manjula since the beginning of our pregnancy. She is a representative of kindness, friendliness, compassion, love and care and goes all her way out to put her patients at ease. 
She is someone who is available at anytime, on call, whatsapp and personally to counsel her patients. In our case, my wife had a bleeding in the early weeks of her pregnancy, and Dr.Manjula ensured we were tension free and safeguarded the health of both my wife and our baby. At every point, she would give us information before hand about what to expect, which made us well prepared for the situation. In our case, my wife had a water break at home, and we were totally panicking. Just a call to Dr.Manjula, and she ensured things happened smoothly. She had already instructed the labour section about our coming, and once we were there, she ensured she arrived in no time(though her presence at that moment was actually not needed), just to comfort us. Also, from the day 1, she prepared my wife for a normal delivery by guiding her with basic exercises and diet, and the result was a normal vaginal delivery. It was late night when my wife was suffering with labour pain, and I was in total pain too seeing her suffer. I requested Dr.Manjula to go for C-section, so that it would ease my wife's pain. However, even in such a situation, she calmed me down, counseled me and brought out our beautiful angel into this world. 

Thank you is a very small word to describe what Dr.Manjula has done for us. We are ever thankful to you and God bless you and your family. Anyone who wants to experience a tension free pregnancy journey just needs to visit Dr.Manjula.

review:
Dr.Manjula came into our lives as a God sent gift. She is a representative of humanity, approachability, friendliness and kindness in treating her patients. My personal experience about doctors made me very apprehensive about the entire fraternity, but she proved otherwise. She knows what each of her patients wants and approaches each of them with a personal touch.

My wife was pregnant with PCOD and she ensured to instill confidence in us and pushed us for a normal delivery. In the first few weeks of pregnancy, my wife started bleeding but she was very calm and ensured that the child was safe and healthy. We had to go through a lot of emotional tension due to the covid situation, but she was always there at any time, be it on call, WhatsApp or personally to counsel and guide us. She answers even the silliest of questions with so much patience, and understands the patient from a motherly perspective. 
Our labour was unexpected since my wife's water broke at home. She immediately responded by coming to the hospital on that day, though it was a holiday, and the procedure could've been initiated by the duty doctor. At my request, she came in and instilled confidence in us. I was unable to see my wife undergo so much pain and called her requesting for a C-section. She calmed me down in this situation and ran in to the delivery room at the odd hour and made the normal vaginal delivery possible. 
Also, a special mention needs to be made about her post pregnancy care. She will be there for you even after delivery and guide you like an elder sister. ln my opinion, Dr.Manjula is an asset not just for Cloud nine hospital but to the entire medical fraternity. God bless her and her family always. She's truly a gem and words fall short to express our gratitude to her. We are lucky to know her and be associated with her. 

Raghu, Mala and our little one.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Doctor friendliness,
review:
I had researched Dr Manjula online as being a doctor who focuses on diet, exercise and natural remedies during pregnancy and she was nearby, which is why we chose to go to her from the first trimester itself! And she certainly lived up to that, giving natural solutions where possible and avoiding medication unnecessarily while helping me stay active during pregnancy!

It was controversial in my family when we chose to go to her instead of the usual doctor family members go to in Manipal, but I'm so glad we did, as our experience was way better than some of the stories we'd heard of about other doctors. Later, I heard that people come from far to visit her and now I understand why and having gone through my entire pregnancy, delivery and recovery with her, with such good experience, I probably will travel any distance for her to be my OB as well :)

Dr Manjula is a ball of energy! In the initial consultations, I found her too fast, though she never rushed us. Even if we forgot to ask her anything, she was always prompt, although not very verbose in answering on whatsapp, giving clear answer to what needs to be done. It's not just her high energy and positivity which made an impression, it was great to hear that she was in CMC Vellore and also to hear positive reviews from other doctors about her! 

My labour was really long and hard and during delivery, we saw that she was certainly very skilled and knowledgeable in various induction and delivery options, aims for least intervention possible, gives you the time needed, explains options and allows you to decide, doesn't rush there either and is adept at performing different procedures too! 

As I write this, it has been one and a half months since we delivered our baby and it was a very smooth journey from the frist trimester to delivery, to recovery now and only because of Dr Manjula's expert guidance and execution! Thanks doc!

I always felt OBs get great reviews online, can they be trusted? though after my almost year long interaction, I'd say this one certainly deserves all her glowing reviews and more! :)

review:
I started consulting Dr Manjula Deepak from the 6th week of my pregnancy . She came highly recommended by people living around in North Bangalore . 
During my first trimester - i was nauseous all the time , puking multiple times in a day and dead tired . To add to that I had a bad bout of fever but Dr Manjula was always quick to respond on whatsapp with remedies . The only thing I looked forward to in my first trimester was waiting outside her consultation room to be called in  . If you ask any of her past or current patients they will tell you how she has a distinct warm way of calling out your name. She is such a positive force that for the duration of the consultation you would forget any pain and discomfort. 
I have always been super active , so my biggest concern was that I wouldn‚Äôt be able to do so during my pregnancy . All my worries disappeared when I met her - she ensured that I had a normal and healthy pregnancy (dispelling a lot of myths regarding food and exercises ) . I was able to continue running after my first trimester right up until the day I delivered . I wholeheartedly thank Dr Manjula for instilling that confidence in me to continue . 

Lastly my family was always quite keen on ensuring that I have a normal vaginal delivery . Dr Manjula recommended exercises throughout my pregnancy and kept monitoring the scans in the last few weeks to ensure that we push for a vaginal delivery as much as possible . So you can imagine how elated we were when I delivered a baby boy vaginally after a labour of just 5 hours . 

There are so many such wonderful instances that my family and I have shared with Dr Manjula Deepak - from the bottom of our hearts we thank you for all your support and guidance and want to tell you that we love you üòä(This space is too small to express our gratitude üôè)

review:
I would like to thank Dr Manjula Deepak mam for helping me and my bundle of joy.
I decided to visit Dr Manjula mam after seeing so many positive reviews in Practo.

With my first meet with Dr Manjula mam itself, I was very confident and comfortable with mam.
Dr mam kept us in ease and mam was very friendly with us. Mam used to answer even our simplest and silly questions with a smile .
Mam was available even in the odd hours like morning  4 am and night 11 pm and so on . I contacted mam when I had an emergency during my labour .
I had severe back ache and my water broke in 36 weeks. I was in emergency and called mam in odd hours . Mam was always available for our questions and support.
My labour was also very pleasant experience because of Dr Manjula mam. She kept me very comfortable during my delivery.  I delivered a baby boy Via C-section on June 13th, 2020. Her soothing voice gave me confidence during my delivery .  I have completely recovered and got discharged in 3 days from hospital and now I am spending happy time with my bundle of joy at my home .

This is my second delivery and I should say this time I had a pleasant pregnancy support and delivery compared to my previous delivery which was also C-section which happened 7 years ago in Chennai in different hospital.

I strongly recommend Dr Manjula Deepak mam. 
Dr Manjula Deepak mam is such a hard working, determined doctor I have ever seen who loves to serve people. Mam is always cheerful and greets us with smile .

Thank you again Dr Manjula Deepak mam for bringing happiness and joy in our family .

review:
I am writing this review as i want it to be helpful for others and share my experience.

Its very hard that you can find a human in this decade who can understand your pain, difficulties and never lets you down. Here comes Manjula mam, who is a paragon of empathy and positive energy. There is a saying that God sometimes lives in the form humans and she is one perfect example for it. I am surely not praising her high, its all the good attributes which requires a strong applause and you will notice all this if you ever got to visit her.

Let me just narrate how she bestowed happiness in to our family. I took my sister to Manjula mam after looking at all positive reviews on Practo( I did not miss even a single review) and did not mind travelling for one hour to meet such efficient doctor. My sister was in complete depression due to her previous pregnancy, where she lost her twins due to preterm delivery in 24 weeks due to complete negligence by previous doctors( Its not easy even for the family members as it took away my complete family happiness). During the first meet itself doctor was able to completely understand the mental status that my sister would be in and gave complete confidence to my sister just like a family member would do. Even the silliest questions where answered without any denial and this made my sister believe that she will be there at any time to help. From the time she conceived and till delivery her emotions were running high and it was Manjula mam who was able to calmly answer all her questions and give her the much required confidence. I don't think anyone else could even do this with much patience. Now my sister got blessed with a Baby boy and it was completely because this time it was God send angel Manjula mam who took care of my sister. I still remember her words " This is my responsibility to give your baby healthy in your hand and will not let a single seed unturned" and she did it.


Thank you Doctor and I wish the very best for you and your family in all aspects of life. I will be definitely recommending Manjula man to all my friends.

Shankar( Malini's Brother)

review:
Visited for pregnancy check up... 
     It's been  a month of my delivery...No words to talk about Dr Manjula deepak mam. She is so friendly and take care of each patient very personally and still remember the condition of every patient.
     When I was 2 months pregnant I had bleeding problem and visited X hospital with one of the doctor instead of consoling or treating she was scolding treated me so badly in my first visit itself I was thinking OMG till 9 months should I visit this doctor.Done with scan and blood test with much difficulty and duty doctor told me that I have gestational diabetes and suggested to come in morning and doctor will start insulin.I was shocked and confused and without second thought she want to start insulin, then me and my husband decided to take an another opinion
  
     we started searching for an another doctor and one of my friend suggested Dr Manjula Deepak mam.... In my first visit manjula madam spoke so nicely and gave so much confidence that no need of insulin and can be controlled through proper diet. I was having both hypertension and gestational diabetes. During my first visit with Mam I felt so good and felt am in safe hands.Mam explained my health condition very clearly made me feel relaxed and gave confident. In every visit mam took care of me so nicely... After 8th month my BP started fluctuating day by day but doctor has given an indication about this in prior to me and my husband and to follow just the instructions given. After 35week every week Mam told to visit frequently and in 36week my bp was getting high n fluid was very low. Next day early morning I got slight pain and messaged mam... Mam asked me to come immediately to hospital and when we reached hospital mam also came immediately and pains started getting more and within two hour delivered my Lil princess. In spite of my health conditions and complications during my pregnancy Manjula Mam made it so easy and I had normal delivery.   Its a big story but worth writing it just because of Manjula Deepak mam

Those who are searching for good gynaecologist without single thought please consult Dr. Manjula deepak - Cloud Nine Hospital.

review: It was a very happy moment to know my wife was pregnant. As usual, I was doing online survey to find a **** doctor (gynecologist). I found Dr. Manjula mam on Practo. After reading some of the reviews, I thought they must be paid ones. But looking at the number of reviews, I was convinced that they are not. So, we decided to go ahead with Manjula mam, even though cashless insurance facility (for the medical insurance I had) was not available in that hospital.Before consulting Dr. Manjula for the first time, I had lots of questions in mind, which I listed down, so that I could ask her. We met the doctor and realized that all the review comments about her are really true. We felt as if we are talking to one of our friends, rather than doctor. She is such a friendly and nice person, having lots of patience to explain us each and everything. Her explanation covered all my questions and I didn't have to ask them. So we decided to stay with the same doctor and not to switch to anyone else.Meanwhile my wife had some problem in the early third month, which was putting her pregnancy under risk. Dr. Manjula mam monitored my wife's condition closely and solved the problem. She even shared her personal mobile number to contact her directly under any emergency. *** ****** ******* *********** *********** ****** ******** ** ** **** **** **** ******* *** ********* She was preparing my wife for normal delivery.Later my baby had some complications, which forced doctor to deliver the baby at 32 weeks. It was not a surprise for us, as doctor had explained us this situation and was monitoring from few weeks back. She wanted to keep the baby in the womb, as long as possible.My wife delivered a boy baby on 8th March 2020 and she is doing fine. Baby is still in intensive care unit, but he is also doing very good. Her positive energy and friendliness towards her patients makes the environment light and relieving. Throughout my pregnancy journey, she kept me informed about each and every detail as to why she is prescribing the medicine,why she‚Äôs asking to avoid a particular food etc.. also she would interact with my husband and mom to make them feel comfortable and answer their doubts too. She encourages all her patients for a normal delivery and is  always reachable on phone or whatsapp for any doubts starting from day ** *** ***** ********** *********** ********* ** ***** *** asks for a scan only when it is required.After seeing so many other practitioners with limited interactions with the patients and who are always In a hurry, she feels like a guardian angel for me. An appointment with Dr.Manjula was never dull and her energy is contagious. I would really miss meeting her and may many people get benefitted with her service in and around HRBR layout. You!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
Well, I conceived last year in the month of April and got it tested through Dr Manjula in hospital. Me and my husband were so happy to know about the news. As the days passed, I got certain complications like spotting (and lumps) in initial days of pregnancy which lasted for almost 10-15 days and Dr Manjula asked me to take a tablet to stop spotting and sustain the pregnancy. I was also asked for a bedrest for 1-2 weeks after which spotting subsided. My dr. was always positive on me and never lost any hope. She always asked me NOT to Google anything and to always stay calm and happy. She believed in miracles and nature and so did I. I just followed her instructions and had supreme faith in my God. But my spotting was on and off till 3 months and I was always tensed on that. That‚Äôs not the end! Other complications like cystic swelling in umbilical chord, cyst in placenta, low lying placenta and a single umbilical artery were also diagnosed in 1st trimester scans..Due to these, I was asked to go through NIPT scan instead of double marker Test to check for the chromosomes related disorder. By grace of god, the reports were normal and also by the 2nd trimester the cysts were not visible. Even the placenta position was high. Spotting was totally stopped and then my pregnancy went smoothly apart from some normal ups and downs like urine infection in 2nd trimester, abdominal pain due to gas some days and other normal symptoms. Every now and then I used to reach hospital to get the scan done and Dr Manjula was like ‚ÄòI am a gone case‚Äô by nowüòä My husband and I used to get tensed so much that we just used to rush hospital without giving a second thought. And Mam was always available on WhatsApp and in hospital no matter what. She always responded to me immediately even in her super busy routine. She is really supportive and friendly and boosts your positivity and motivation level. I always got positive vibes from her. Moreover, she is always with full energy and so active that seeing her will really make you feel happy! Till the end, she had full faith on me that I will be able to deliver normally and I did it in her presence! A great doctor and above all, a great human being and so much down to earth. Having so many degrees and so much experience of handling many cases of complicated deliveries, she has no proud and is very sophisticated and patient. Would highly recommend her. Wishing to have my next pregnancy (if at all we plan) with her as well! God willing!

Wishing her all the best for all her future endeavours. God bless you Mam! Thankyou so much for giving us our precious gift!
reply_text: Thank you very much for your kind words it means a lot to me

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
Dr. Manjula Deepak, The Angel 

Ours is a story of ups, downs, losses, endless tears, sleepless nights,  dreams,  hopes and finally a happy beginning!

I got pregnant for the first time after 3 years of marriage in 2020, which unfortunately turned out to be an ectopic pregnancy and I had to undergo an emergency salpinogectomy at Cloudnine HRBR to remove my right fallopian tube . As much as we were Thankful to God for saving us at the right time and preventing a fatality,  things went down South for us since then..... We faced a plethora of issues -   Low AMH, uncertainity of the left fallopian tube favouring a pregnancy,  doctors giving up on us and pushing us into IVF, which we even attempted and failed at, doctor giving up on me saying that "You Would Never Be Able to Conceive Naturally" , "Another IVF is the only option".  
We didn't have the energy to attempt another IVF and moved on and decided to give the hospital visits a break. During one of the hospital lab visits at Cloudnine HRBR, a senior nurse heard my story and recommended DR.Manjula Deepak. She said that i could just meet her once and I wouldn't even have to pay for the consultation, which amused me. I went ahead and met Manjuala ma'am, who was a person beaming with positive energy, she pushed me to believe that i will get pregnant and have my baby in my arms within a year.  A couple of months later, we saw a ray of hope when I conceived naturally. It was unbelievable to see something tiny grow inside me in the 4th week scan, which Manjula ma'am revealed. Unfortunately,  that ended up in a blighted Ovum and I was heartbroken. I remember breaking down terribly in Manjula ma'am's cabin. She stood by us and still didn't give up on me and asked me to meet Dr.Manju Nair, her very good friend at Cloudnine Fertility to help me further.

I consulted Dr.Manju Nair, a very positive & energetic doctor, for a month and she helped me with the accurate timing and provided me the right kind of medicines. In a month,  I conceived naturally again.  My heart was racing when Dr.Manjula Deepak performed my first scan at 4th week.  This time it looked better than the previous time and we had our fingers crossed for the next scan.  We prayed all Gods to bless us this time at least. Majula ma'am was very confident,  but I wasn't able to pull myself up considering my previous bitter experience.  

Finally the day of my first important scan arrived. My heart was racing like a train and I was just hoping that the radiologist could find a tiny heart beat inside me. I had mixed feelings as I lay in the scan room... when I suddenly heard the radiologist say "Can you hear that? That's your baby's heart beat".  Happiness is not just the right word to describe what I felt at that moment. 

 Manjula ma'am's belief and God's blessings finally turned things positive for us.  We can't thank Manjula ma'am enough for the support she extended throughout the 9 months even with my GDM issue,  filing us with her contagious positive energy and pushing us through every step till the final decisive day.... We had walked in for my final consultation to discuss my birth plan when Manjula ma'am's instinct told her to perform a C- section on the very same day.  We weren't prepared mentally,  I didn't even have my hospital bag ready! and I was ready for my C-section in 5 hours. We blindly trusted Manjula Madam cos we knew that she couldn't go wrong.  We were glad that we didn't push ourselves for induced labour, considering my previous history.  On April 21st 2022, at 5.06PM , I heard my little one cry in that OT and felt her soft skin on my cheek.... tears came rolling down..it was a dream come true.. 
Manjula ma'am's instinct saved us even at that moment since my baby had a loop of cord around her neck and any delay could have put us through situations we couldn't have imagined. 

Dr. Manjula Deepak - An angel with Positive energy, zeal,  never give up attitude and belief in God. She is the reason why we never gave up.  She is the reason why I am a mother today.  As I celebrate my first mother's day,  I would like to thank Dr.Manjula Deepak from the bottom of my heart for not giving up on me and keeping up her promise of bringing my little one into the world within a year of facing a frantic downhill path. 

The world needs such doctors! We love you Manjula ma'am ‚ù§Ô∏è  
Thank you Dr. Manjula Deepak and the amazing staff of Cloudnine HRBR for making the entire experience a smooth and memorable one üòä
reply_text: Thank you very much for your kind words it means a lot to me

review: Please note that we are sharing our experience with an hope that it may help someone who would be searching for good gynecologist and with a wish that even everyone should get the same experience what we have got... Whatever I'm sharing here is purely based on our own experience, this is not to influence/impress anyone nor by someone's compulsion.I'm not sure from where to start but even till today we just can't believe ourselves that we have met a doctor who will make you feel as you are one of their dearest friend...Yes that's true... We just choosed Manjula Deepak by reading the reviews updated on Practo (We should thank the people who have updated their honest experience on Practo). We got wondered by the number of reviews updated and the ratings provided by everyone on Practo, me and my husband started thinking is this doctor really good as described by everyone here. We were regular to Malleshwaram Cloudnine branch and after we shifted to TC Palya Main road it became difficult (travelling from TC Palya to Malleshwaram everytime) to visit the gynecologist (don't want to mention the name) whom we were visiting regularly so we started searching for good gynecologist around our location, as usual we started searching through online, In between in the month of Jun-19 I had some concerns on my health and by considering the number of years of experience provided on practo doctor's profile we choosed one of the senior gynecologist with 30  years experience (again don't want to mention their name) and visited Cloudnine HRBR and it was just normal consultation and was really not happy with that consultation so again started searching for gynecologist and luckily I found Manjula Deepak's profile on Practo and found that she is available in Cloudnine HRBR branch so consulted her for first time for the same problem, as that was a very ignorable concern she also suggested the same advice as previous senior gynecologist suggested, but in my first consultation only I'm pretty much impressed by her nature, the confidence and the feeling I got on her after coming out from the consultation room was completely different. Almost for a week I discussed about Manjula Deepak with my husband by describing him about her nature, the way she spoke to me with regard to my health concern, her dressing sense, after listening to all this even my husband told me that the way you are describing her gives me a feeling that she is a doctor with different qualities so let's continue with her. Yes I should completely agree on it and sure she has blessed with unique personalities to be a doctor.The reason I was checking for gynecologist in May-19 month was to plan for our second baby and before that I wanted to get clarified on few concerns I was having on my health. Later in Oct-19 I became pregnant and off course how can I think of anyone else when Manjula ma'am is around us. Our journey went so smoothly not even a single day I had different thought in my mind, we were so relaxed and our confidence level was keep boosting post every consultation by the way she was explaining, by the way she was making us understand each and everything in detail was really phenomenal. We blessed with baby girl on 10th Jun 2020 and seriously I just can't describe how everything went smoothly and without facing any hurdle our little one entered the world.A big thanks to Doctor Manjula Deepak for making us to feel proud parents of our little one... Thank you MD ma'am... We wish all the very best to you... Triveni Hareesh

Here I am finally writing about my experience with Dr Manjula, as I and my husband embraced parenthood all we wanted was to find the right doctor, after a long search and visits to various hospitals and meeting with numerous doctors we landed at cloudnine HRBR to meet Dr Manjula.

After all the reviews I read and heard I finally bagged my opportunity to meet Manjula, my first meeting with her was very positive, her vibrant personality and her nature got us to stick on and choose her to be our doctor for the next 9 months until we welcomed our daughter on June 18th 2023 through a normal delivery.

She was ever ready to help, assist and soothe us throughout our journey and made it fun-filled, safe and joyous.

In the era of csection she made sure I had a normal delivery, thanks to her confidence in me and to have made us feel confident enough to get through the whole process of delivering my little one.

Through her energy, wisdom and care Dr Manjula in our lives made waves of memories, thank you doc.! You'll never be forgotten.

review: Doctor Manjula Deepak was literally a god send for us. We shifted to cloudnine hrbr after consulting with a major hospital for almost 9 months. Doctor took us on in first week of December with the due date being 22nd Dec. In the first meeting itself she spoke to us and counselled us more than 30 mins. She explained everything patiently, advised exercises, and dietary changes to help the onset of labour smoothly. Finally we elected to go in for a c section as my wife was not dilating and also had adenomyosis/ fibroid. I was allowed in the operation theatre during the procedure and could be there with my wife to speak to her and support her. it was a magic moment as I saw my daughter pulled out swiftly by the magical hands of this doctor. Doctor took extra care to look into minor aspects related to the surgery, to make sure my wife was comfortable throughout. It was a landmark day for us. Doctor is available throughout on call, whatsapp, sms etc. she will always get back to you for any concern even after delivery. overall an excellent experience with Dr Manjula.

We visited Dr.Manjula Deepak as soon as we decided to have a baby. Right from our first appointment, her friendly response, advices, treatment made us feel so homely and comfortable that I couldn't thank god enough for helping us find her.  
Throughout my pregnancy, Dr.Manjula consistently guided me towards a healthy and traditional delivery where I followed all her suggestions by keeping myself physically active which only helped me towards a healthy baby. It was until my 9th month scan where I was worried after knowing that my baby is in breech position and it could be a C section if the baby doesn't turn down. I was disheartened knowing that. tags: Treatment satisfaction,Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,
review:
Dr Manjula is an angel with a stethoscope for me! 
She shows empathy, which for me many doctors failed at. She put me at ease, answered my questions (believe me, I had many and at every appointment) and in tough times, she gave me a hope and a prayer. She let me know the procedures before hand and explained it in detail, be it as minute as a need for an injection. Personally, she prefers her patients to undergo a vaginal delivery if possible but when it was decided as a c-section for me, she supported me and made sure I did not fall into a guilt trip! ( Well, cos I was mentally preparing for a vaginal delivery for 9 months!). I'll never forget her saying that she doesn't want me to have a traumatic birthing experience (no one ever told me that birthing could be an experience otherwise). And so it was, not a pain free but a trauma free experience! Amidst her daily count of dozens of patients, she remembered a tiniest detail about my condition and ensured to tell the on duty doctor prior to my surgery and made sure that I do not undergo any stress cos of that. You would see her enter the hospital with an aura that will just awe you. I have seen her at the hospital at odd hours attending to patients, spending overnight after a procedure and finally meeting lots of other patients the next day with the same zest. Sometimes I wonder if she gets a break or vacation ever. 
So yeah I did finally find a trustworthy, my go-to obgyn afterall!

review:
Consulted Doctor Manjula Deepak for pregnancy. 
This was my first pregnancy and I had conceived MCDA twins .
I wanted to consult someone with good experience given my case .She came highly recommended by colleagues and friends . 
From my experience she is definitely someone who knows what she is doing . She explained things well , she was very open to questions / doubts  and She was extremely friendly and this made me very comfortable. One thing that I have personally observed on many occasions is that she will not prescribe unnecessary medications , I have personally seen her avoid or prescribe a lower dose . 
She also has an excellent memory, she would almost remember everything I discussed to her in my previous visit and would follow up on that in the next visit . It was reassuring to me that she understood things around me and wasn‚Äôt just looking at reports . 

I safely delivered my boys via c section . She was so swift at the procedure and kept me comfortable in the OT .  All my family members too were very impressed with her work. 

I would highly recommend Dr Manjula Deepak.I am very happy that I consulted her.

review: I don't think a doctor can have a better bonding with their patients what you have with yours. Please don't change this.In a way your approach towards your patients make them feel better sometimes without even using medicine. Two doctors can read a same book and do the same practical but decision making is something which makes one better from another. My wife just completed 28 weeks of her gestational period and was suffering from severe pre eclampsia. She reached to 8.2 for euric acid and 3  for urine albumin. With those numbers she could have had multiple organ failure at any time. But you made a decision to get the delivery done and saved both the mother and the baby. The baby was only 840 gm. I felt it was a co incidence when I changed from a top notch gynecologist  on 4th month of her pregnancy for some reason(no offense, some doctors are not for everyone) to another top one (Manjula) üòÄ. Our experience with Dr. Manjula Deepak was amazing. My wife was advised by our previous doctor to terminate pregnancy due to multiple fibroids and thereafter to go for laparoscopic myomectomy to remove fibroids.  After termination of pregnancy, my wife continued bleeding for three months. We were scared and confused as the bleeding was not stopping. Then my colleague recommended me to visit Dr. Manjula Deepak.  Me and my wife was very much impressed with her confidence and explanations at the very first meeting. She gave medicine for the bleeding to stop and waited for the normal menstrual cycle to return before planning for surgery. She advised for open myomectomy as the fibroids were big in size and suggested us to plan for pregnancy after two months of surgery. The journey of pregnancy won‚Äôt be that seamless without her guidance and support. Finally, my wife had caesarian delivery and we were blessed with a baby boy. Dr Manjula Deepak is an amazing person, and I haven‚Äôt met such a down to earth doctor in my life. I can blindly recommend Dr. Manjula Deepak to any couple who are planning to have child. tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
I visited Dr Manjula for my second pregnancy.  She is very friendly and approachable doctor which is a very important factor during pregnancy and child birth. She is full of energy and is very passionate about her profession which is quite evident when you see her. On the first consultation itself she shared her phone number where we could get our queries answered. ( which is rare these days).
For every query, she promptly responded and I did not have to run to the hospital for a consultation. She also made sure that I avoid multiple trips to the hospital in  covid times.

In my 9th month, when the baby had not descended, she asked me to get a scan to check if everything was alright. As she rightly suspected , baby had not one but three chords around the neck. The radiologist mentioned to me that usually doctors prefer a c-section in such cases which worried me as I was very keen on a normal delivery. But Dr Manjula calmed us down and explained the situation to us in detail. She also assured us that she will try her best to make sure its a normal delivery and only if there is an emergency she will go for a c-section.

On the day of induction, she made sure the staff was briefed and made sure the whole process was monitored meticulously. Finally with her efforts and the supportive staff, my baby was delivered normally.

Thank you doctor for making my pregnancy a pleasant and a happy one!

Excellent motivator, always kept our spirits high, very punctual and prompt in her advice on what my wife needed to do. Be it be exercise, diet, next scans and what to watch out for each trimester. Even just before the delivery, she showcased traits of an amazing and determined doctor, visited us multiple times the night we got admitted in the hospital, and thanks to her awareness and super duper skills in the Operation Theatre, the entire birth of my baby was handled by Dr. Manjula with utmost care and perfection and we are now proud parents to a beautiful baby girl born naturally. We are forever indebted to you Doctor. You are definitely one of the best and would recommend you to every potential parent to be. Thanks for everything.

review: I am writing for me and my wife Greeshma. This is the first time I am writing any review for anyone or anything. Hence I don't know how to write. I am writing here what I felt about our Doctor and what was her influence all during my wife's pregnancy period and delivery care. To be frankly speaking I don't have words to thank the doctor for taking care of my wife during whole ten months. She is so cool and she never gave us a chance to get worried about anything. She always answers our queries, worries sometimes unwanted ones. She cleared our doubts even though phone. My wife gets tensed so fast even for silly reasons and our doctor was there always to keep her nerves cool. My wife had gone through a low placenta issue, but Dr. Manjula took care of it.  She had never suggested any medication and instead she always pressed for a good diet. Most importantly I need to mention the incident happened one day before the delivery. We approached doctor with a scan report on 39th week which says fluid inside the womb is less and it's almost half only. Hence delivery has to happen immediately not to pose any problem for the baby. That time also doctor was saying 'nothing to worry. We will start the procedure today itself and 95 percent chance is there for the delivery to be normal'. And the delivery was normal. I blindly recommend the doctor for anyone. You husbands can sit and relax if you have doctor Manjula to take care of your wife.

We would like to recommend Dr. Manjula Deepak to everyone without any second thoughts. She is talented, professional, energetic, friendly and confident. She doesn't have the typical doctor's superior attitude. She treats everyone equally. After the first visit you will never feel that you are going to meet a doctor. She used to answer all the queries how silly it is, through whatsapp or over the phone. 

We met her on 2019 on our friend's recommendation. Before meeting her I had two miscarriages as I am a type -II diabetic. This care and actions were missing in my previous two pregnancies. I am super happy about Dr. Manjula. She is awesome!!!!!

review:
I am very thankful to Dr. Manjula Deepak for her support and guidance throughout my pregnancy journey. I experienced spotting in my 1st trimester and was suggested to take progesterone tabs and injection from the other doctor whom I was consulting. She had suggested bed rest. When I came to Dr. Manjula for 2nd opinion, she just asked me take tablets and go to her for injection only if I experience spotting again. Luckily it was all fine. She is always available on WhatsApp for any queries. She suggests home remedies, exercises and diet which helps for normal delivery. *** **** *** ********* *********** ******* ***** *** *********** 
Though I preferred a normal delivery, I was a bit hesitant about it when we got to know that my baby was a little heavier. But she was very sure that I could make it as I am a yoga instructor. She asked me not to opt for epidural as she was sure that I can bear the pain. She encouraged me a lot in labour room, her voice still echos in my ear. As I requested her not to use forceps, she did not use it even though it was really necessary. Finally I had a normal delivery without epidural of my lil princess who was 3.8kgs. I thank you again for all ur encouragement and support.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Here is my second pregnancy story, 
Before Delivery:
I am 34 and it was my second pregnancy after 6 years of my first delivery. From the beginning  i wanted  it to be a normal delivery, since the first one was C section and i did not want to go through it again, Doctor Manjula was very supportive and encouraged me to do normal from day one i started seeing her.
On Delivery Day:
The pain started on April 12th early Morning and it was periodic pain, Morning  7.30AM I did whats-app text to  Dr.Manjula and she asked me to go to Cloud nine by 8:30. She checked me by 9:00 AM and said pain is started it may take 5 to 6 hrs and we will go for normal all looks good. I was took to the Labor room immediately with Husband. Next few hours was horrible since the pain was keep going up and down, by 11:30 they induced pain  and i was not able to bear the pain and i went for the epidural injection to reduce pain, by 2:03PM I delivered a baby boy and they allowed Husband to be with me in the delivery.  It was good instructions and care from Dr. Manjula and nurses from Cloud nine made me it possible. Post delivery I was in the hospital for 3 days and they took care of Baby and me very well.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: I met Dr. Manjula Deepak for the first time in 2nd half of 2017 when I was struggling to conceive. her friendly nature and reassuring words helped me and my husband through tough times over the next 1.5 years and finally when Doctor told us pregnancy scan is positive for the first time after the initial shock, our joy knew no bounds as we have been waiting to hear those words for more than 3 years. during the last 8 months I took so much care not to make unnecessary movements and strict diet but despite all this, I experienced labour in my 32nd week of pregnancy. it was a harrowing time for me and my husband as this was a nightmare come real for us. Luckily for us the only thing that kept us going was the constant vigil kept by the nurses and Dr.manjula's reassuring words that despite all this we will deliver the baby normally. and true to her words our baby girl arrived through normal delivery and after 2 weeks of NICU observation, we were delighted to bring our baby girl home. in our family we usually go to mother's hometown for pregnancy after 7th month but I decided way earlier that IAM going ahead with dr.manjula for several reasons and the topmost reason is her ability to reassure me of my doubts and her extreme friendly nature. Now I am going out of way to recommend all our friends and colleagues to go and consult with her.

review:
We have doctors in family and close relatives but we never took opinion of anyone to consult Gynecologist, the hospital was very near 700mts from our home so we opted for Cloudnine and we just walked in and took appointment with Dr Manjula Deepak as we saw her for first time and felt good by her talk and friendliness with the patients and staff. I Would like to thank Dr Manjula Deepak for the treatment of my wife and my 2 babies, doctor is very friendly , available all the time though she is busy make sure our queries are answered anytime 24/7, clears all our doubts . Thank you doctor for being their all the time. She is just not a doctor ,she is a friend, family member ,well-wisher and guide .We feel pampered each time we visit the doctor. God‚Äôs gift to all the mother's to be.
I referred my colleague to consult the doctor and she also had normal delivery and she thanked us so much for referring and also we are still referring to our friends.

1st pregnancy ‚Äì baby girl, normal delivery. 
During 5th month pregnancy the amniotic fluid was less and there was blockage in placenta, doctor gave proper supplements and the fluid level increased which prevented preterm birth, also the case was placenta previa. Doctor encouraged us and every time we visit we had positive thoughts as she never spoke any negative thing and made sure my wife will have normal delivery which indeed it was full term 40 weeks. Thanks to doctor. 

2nd pregnancy ‚Äì baby boy, normal delivery.
This time throughout pregnancy the amniotic fluid was beyond high range and the baby growth was more also the head circumference was little high which was problem for normal delivery. But doctor gave strict diet to follow and check for fluid level often and after completion of 37 weeks my wife had normal delivery. 

Lastly I have seen doctor in hospital during day time attending patients in OPD with full enthusiasm and positive mood even though she will be in labor ward during night, the way she manage and carry herself is great. Her energy and commitment towards work is inspiration.

review: I still remember that day when I met Manjula ma'am. We went to hospital for my blood test and nurse saw me crying due to my pregnancy complications. Me and my husband both shared our problems with details of complications and issues. After listening to everything she was very calm and said don't worry its a "miracle baby" and everything will be fine. We were shocked to see her reaction and calmness but we totally believed and followed her. From the first day she has been our support, the confidence she has given was remarkable. She was available day and night and has patiently handled me throughout my pregnancy. I was very scared looking at the reports all the time but she was very confident from day 1 which was actually our biggest strength. We were alone in Bangalore due to pandemic but with her support we managed all very easily. I can't thank her enough for what she did and the strength and confidence she gave us during these times. I delivered my child early morning and she was there with me. She has always been answering our n no. of questions patiently. tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: What could I even say about Manjula mam , she is fantabulous , amazing , friendly and super cool doctor I have ever seen. She is one who filled positivity in me and my husband in our difficult phase of pregnancy. Ok , let me explain what we went through in our pregnancy journey and how we over came it by Manjula mam. I got pregnant in October 2020 , consulted doctor in another hospital and we got confirmed that we are pregnant. As all others even we were very happy for our baby and initial scans went well. Next came Anamoly scanning where doctor scared us saying baby is growing abnormal and asked us to go for NIPT test. Me and my partner were very much scared to go for it , Later my cousin suggested Manjula mam , we took appointment and went to her. That was the best decision we both made , she saw all our old reports and said all good no need to go for any sort of test and she didn't even asked us to go for Anamoly scanning again , she just asked us to come for growth scanning in 7th month by filling all positivity in us. We trusted her and did our baby's growth scanning too. Issue was baby's weight and it had maintained well. Later again in 8th month there was fluctuations in weight but still doctor didn't scare us and gave me good supplements which really helped baby grow well. All that we were expecting was a healthy baby with good weight. Again in 9th month baby's weight was just 1.8kg , but still doctor didn't scare us and motivated me walhat all to eat and make baby weight gain more. Repeatedly AFI was there to check water level and by mam's and god's grace  we couldn't even  believe baby's weight and water level was maintained well. On June 18th as per doctor's suggestion I delivered my cute little princess through c section and we couldn't believe baby's weight was 2.72KG where in our dreams also we didn't imagine. Even for delivery mam tried max for normal one whole day , since baby's head didn't support at the end she went for immediate c section. Than all , baby was healthy which is most important ‚ò∫Ô∏è All this credits really goes to Manjula mam who made our pregnancy journey go well by delivering healthy baby. Thanks a lot mam‚ò∫Ô∏è I would really recommend her for each and every girl who likes her pregnancy journey to go well.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: We are comparatively new to Bangalore, and when I conceived I was at a loss when it came to selecting an obstetrician for my pregnancy management. I found Dr. Manjula on Practo, and I am so glad we decided to consult her as our doctor during my pregnancy. I first visited her when I was 14 weeks pregnant, and since then there was no looking back  Dr.Manjula's care, sincerity and high energy at every visit touched our hearts,and we felt we met out guardian angel on Earth. She has been by our sides at every back and call, always responding to my queries, and questions,and trying to soothe my anxiety when I read up too much on the internet and asked her all kinds of questions regarding pregnancy. The ride, has not been smooth, just as other medical cases in general. I was diagnosed with GDM during my 28th week, which was borderline, and a nutritionist put me on  strict GDM diet. Between weeks 28-35 I had an intuition that my baby's growth in-vitro might have been restricted with reduced baby movements,and when I finally voiced this concern to Dr.Manjula, she immediately guided me on next steps. Based on the test results,we jointly decided to deliver my baby the very next day through C-section. We are now proud parents of a beautiful baby boy, all because of Dr.Manjula's expertise and timely decisions. I believe the Dr.-patient relationship has evolved and matured over time and I look forward to our prolonged association, for her guidance and advice at every step. Thank you Dr. for all that you do for each of your patients. May God Bless You Always!

review:
Doctors are next to God they say.....and the same we experienced. Before starting our story we would like to thanks Dr. Manjula Deepak for all her support she provided during pre and post delivery. We are blessed with baby girl and she is 1 month old now :).

It was our first baby so we were very excited but at the same time we were little afraid as well due to the Covid-19 situation. ** ****** ** ***** *** **** ****** ** ** ******** ** *** ******** *** ****** ** **** ** *** ******** even friends of friends and got to know about Dr Manjula. During our first visit we were still not sure if the decision was right, but all these confusions went off once we met her and we decided to continue with her. The best thing about her is she never makes her patients feel that they are meeting a doctor. It always feels like we are meeting our friend. She always calls the patient with name and even remembers patient's husband's name and calls him also with name.

We consulted her till 7 months of my pregnancy but due to Covid situation we planned the delivery in my native. During our travel we needed "Fit to Fly" certificate and we would like to thank the cloudnine staff that within half an hour they prepared the document, get it signed by the doctor and provided us on whatsapp. Even we would like to thank the doctor that she gave her precious time and helped us with priority.

Even after reaching there we were always in touch with her. We got a doctor there and even she was good but no one can match Dr. Manjula. We were always thinking whether the decision to move to our native was right or not. But Dr Manjula was just a call away from us. Still she was supporting us and we were so open to her that even for some silly questions we used to whatsapp her. She patiently replied to all our queries on whatsapp as well as on call. Finally a little angel came into our lives through normal delivery. The exercise suggested by her helped us a lot.

Even post delivery we are still in touch with her and she still replies us very patiently. Waiting to see you doctor and thank you personally once we reach Bangalore.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review:
The reason we started seeing Dr. Manjula was that we wanted a normal delivery for our baby. In our 38th week scan, we found that the baby had 2 loops of cord around the neck. Baby weight was estimated to be 3.8 kgs. If there were any other doctor, they would have right away done a c-section. 

Dr. Manjula told us that she'd try to deliver the baby naturally but will not rule out emergency c section, should there be a problem with baby's oxygen levels. She suggested us not to wait for natural labor pains to start (which could go up to week 40), by when baby's weight could increase to up to 4 kgs. She induced labor and we were able to deliver the baby naturally without an epidural. Can't thank Dr. Manjula enough for being so patient with us and not scaring us with the usual last minute emergency c-section that other doctors do. Highly recommend her, especially for those seeing normal deliveries.
